abstract.text: FIELD: oil and gas production. ^ SUBSTANCE: invention refers to a method of preparing and fine processing of hydrocarbon stock involving heating of stock and hydrogen, preparation of end-products; herewith liquid (oil, black oil, oil refining and petrochemistry remains) charge stock is heated up to the temperature above 20-50C and exposed to thermal and/or thermomechanical (non-catalytic) cracking, molecular hydrogen and/or hydrogen enriched light hydrogenous mediums (natural or accompanying gas, gas and light fractions of oil refining and petrochemistry), if required are heated up separately from charge stock, supplied at greater pressure than that of the heating stage, to the stage of producing active atomic hydrogen and/or light radicals to a reactor or reactor package with a catalyst heated to the required temperature, thereafter produced active hydrogen and/or light radicals are supplied to a stock heating and cracking zone for the reaction; the reaction products are supplied to the separation stage; a portion of gas and light fractions and also unreacted hydrogen and/or light hydrogenous initial mediums after the separation stage are supplied to the start of the process and introduced into the charge stock, light end fractions of reaction after the separation stage mainly with end boiling point to 350-360C, partially or completely supplied on the stage of producing light end commodity products (condensed gas, petrol, kerosene, diesel fuel) and/or partially returned and introduced into charge stock, heavy remains after the separation stage mainly with start boiling point 360C and above, are partially or completely supplied for producing heavy commodity products (bitumen, coke), and, probably, partially or completely supplied for reprocessing by the given method to the start of the process together with charge stock; the stock and/or separation remain cracking and heating stages, hydrogen and/or hydrogenous medium and catalyst heating, production of active atomic hydrogen and/or light radicals and separation into light portion and heavy remains are combined in one device, and the ratio of the surface of the reactor or reactors with the catalyst to volume of the stock heating and/or cracking shall be increased so that maximally increase the interaction (reaction) area of atomic hydrogen and/or light radicals and heated or cracked hydrocarbon stock for effective utilisation of reacting products. The invention also concerns a unit for preparation and fine processing of hydrocarbon stock. ^ EFFECT: higher yield of light end products. ^ 19 cl, 3 tbl, 15 dwg

Изобретение относится к нефтеперерабатывающей, нефтехимической и химической промышленности. Изобретение касается способа подготовки и глубокой переработки углеводородного сырья, включающего нагрев сырья и водорода, получение конечных продуктов, при этом жидкое (нефть, мазут, остатки нефтепереработки и нефтехимии) исходное сырье нагревают до температуры выше 20-50°С и подвергают термическому и/или термомеханическому (некаталитическому) крекингу, молекулярный водород и/или легкие водородсодержащие среды, обогащенные водородом (природный или попутный газ, газ и легкие фракции нефтепереработки и нефтехимии), при необходимости подогревают отдельно от сырья, направляют при большем давлении, чем давление на стадии нагрева и крекинга, на стадию получения активного атомарного водорода и/или легких радикалов в реактор или пакет реакторов с нагретым до необходимой температуры катализатором, после которого полученные активный водород и/или легкие радикалы направляют в зону нагрева и крекинга сырья для проведения реакции, продукты реакции направляют на стадию разделения, часть газовых и легких фракций, а также непрореагировавшего водорода и/или легких водородосодержащих исходных сред после стадии разделения направляют в начало процесса и вводят в исходное сырье, легкие целевые фракции реакции после стадии разделения, преимущественно с температурой конца кипения до 350-360°С, частично или полностью направляют на стадию получения легких целевых товарных продуктов (сжиженный газ, бензин, керосин, дизельное топливо) и/или частично возвращают и вводят в исходное сырье, тяжелый остаток после стадии разделения, преим�

invention_title.text: COMPOSITION AND METHOD FOR MANUFACTURING ETTRINGITE COATED FIBER AND AGGLOMERATE
에트린자이트 코팅된 섬유 및 응집체 제조를 위한 조성물과방법

abstract.text: PURPOSE: A fiber is provided to sediment an ettringite crystalline on the surface of the fiber or the other disposition in a hydrogenous medium. CONSTITUTION: An ettringite coated agglomerate is manufactured by: generating an ettringite in a hydrogenous slurry while being near a fiber, an agglomerate, or other filling material for forming a mineralized complex material including an ettringite treated fiber, agglomerate, or other filling material; and the ettringite treated fiber, agglomerate, and other filling material reacting in the existence of water for forming the ettringite by adding a reactive material such as a calcium oxide and a sulfuric aluminium being sedimented to the surface of the treated fiber or the other disposition. Therefore, the ettringite treated fiber, agglomerate, and other filling material are added to a hydrogenous hardening material for improving a chemical and a mechanical combinations between the fiber and other dispositions in a concrete material.

섬유, 응집체 및 기타 충진재의 표면상에 에트린자이트 (3CaO·AlO·3Ca(SO)·30-32HO)를 침전시키기 위한 방법 및 조성물이 발표된다. 에트린자이트는 섬유, 응집체 또는 기타 충진재 근처에서 수성현탁액내에 생성되어 에트린자이트로 코팅된 섬유, 응집체 또는 기타 충진재를 포함하는 광물화된 복합재료를 형성한다. 에트린자이트 처리된 섬유, 응집체 또는 기타 충진재는 물의 존재하에서 반응하여 에트린자이트를 형성하며 이후에 처리되는 섬유 또는 기타 기질 표면상에 침전하는 칼슘산화물 및 황산알루미늄과 같은 반응물을 첨가함으로써 형성된다. 에트린자이트 처리된 섬유, 응집체 또는 기타 충진재는 수경화성 재료에 첨가되어서 결과의 경화된 수경화성 복합재료, 특히 시멘트 또는 콘크리트재료내에 섬유 또는 기타 기질간의 화학적 및 기계적 결합을 향상시킬 수 있다.

abstract.text: The plate (10) has a main surface for a fuel cell stack, where the surface is surrounded by outer edges (14) of the plate. A cathode input and a cathode output are provided at a cathode side, and an anode input and an anode output are provided at an anode side. A hydrogenous medium is fed to the anode side and a medium containing oxygen is fed to the cathode side. An outer edge of the stack is freely accessible, where the plate is coated at its outer edges by a sealant (15) and the sealant forms a frame (16) around the plate. A polymer material is provided as the sealant.

Die Erfindung betrifft eine Bipolarplatte mit von einer Außenkante (14) umgebenen Hauptfläche für einen Brennstoffzellenstapel aus einer Mehrzahl von jeweils durch die Bipolarplatten getrennten Brennstoffzellen mit einer Kathodenseite mit einem Kathodeneingang und einem Kathodenausgang sowie einer Anodenseite mit einem Anodeneingang und einem Anodenausgang, wobei der Anodenseite ein wasserstoffhaltiges Medium und der Kathodenseite ein sauerstoffhaltiges Medium zuführbar ist und wobei Außenkanten des Brennstoffzellenstapels frei zugänglich sind. DOLLAR A Es wird vorgeschlagen, dass die Bipolarplatte (10) an ihrer Außenkante (14) rahmenartig von einem Dichtmittel (15) umhüllt ist. DOLLAR A Die Erfindung betrifft ferner eine Brennstoffzelle mit einer solchen Bipolarplatte (10).

abstract.text: Provided is an austenitic stainless steel material that has high strength and excellent fatigue crack propagation resistance in a hydrogen environment. The chemical composition of the austenitic stainless steel material of the present disclosure, as defined in the description, satisfies formula (1); the elemental content and grain size number (GSN) in μm satisfy formula (2); and the tensile strength (TS), which is 730 MPa or more, the number density of inclusions (NDI) having an equivalent circle diameter of 2.0 μm or more per 4.0 mm2, and the number density of carbonitrides (NDC) having an equivalent circle diameter of 1.0 μm or more per mm2 satisfy formula (3).　(1) Nb + V ≤ 0.55; (2) 10FnA - 0.2FnB + 4.5GSN ≥ 39.0, where FnA and FnB in formula (2) are defined by formulas (A) and (B);　(A) FnA = 2N + C; (B) FnB = -7.1 + 2.8Ni + 0.49Cr + 2Mo - 2Si + 0.75Mn - 5.7C - 24N; (3) 0.5NDI + NDC + 0.02TS ≤ 30.0.

La divulgation concerne un matériau d'acier inoxydable austénitique qui présente une résistance élevée et une excellente résistance à la propagation de fissures de fatigue dans un environnement d'hydrogène. La composition chimique du matériau d'acier inoxydable austénitique de la présente divulgation, telle que définie dans la description, satisfait la formule (1) ; la teneur élémentaire et l'indice granulométrique (GSN) en µm satisfont la formule (2) ; et la résistance à la traction (TS), qui est supérieure ou égale à 730 MPa, la densité en nombre d'inclusions (NDI) ayant un diamètre de cercle équivalent supérieur ou égal à 2,0 µm par 4,0 mm2, et la densité en nombre de carbonitrures (NDC) ayant un diamètre de cercle équivalent supérieur ou égal à 1,0 µm par mm2 satisfont la formule (3).　(1) Nb + V ≤ 0,55 ; (2) 10 FnA - 0,2 FnB + 4,5 GSN ≥ 39,0, où FnA et FnB dans la formule (2) sont définis par les formules (A) et (B) ; (A) FnA = 2N + C ; (B) FnB = -7,1 + 2,8 Ni + 0,49 Cr + 2 Mo - 2 Si + 0,75 Mn - 5,7 C - 24 N ; (3) 0,5 NDI + NDC + 0,02 TS ≤ 30,0.

invention_title.text: Method and system for synergistically testing and evaluating fatigue and fracture of metal material in hydrogen environment
氢环境金属材料疲劳和断裂协同试验与评价方法及系统

extracted_name.value: CNPC ENGINEERING MAT R & D COMPANY LIMITED
中国石油天然气集团有限公司,
中国石油集团工程材料研究院有限公司

abstract.text: The invention relates to a hydrogen environment metal material fatigue and fracture cooperative test and evaluation method and system, and belongs to the field of metal material hydrogen environment compatibility. The method comprises the following steps: performing a fatigue crack propagation test and a fracture toughness test on a fatigue and fracture synergistic test sample in a hydrogen environment with preset pressure and preset temperature; based on the obtained fatigue crack propagation curve and the obtained crack propagation resistance curve, obtaining a fatigue crack propagation fitting curve and a fracture toughness characteristic value in the hydrogen environment with the preset pressure and the preset temperature; and based on the fatigue crack propagation fitting curve and the fracture toughness characteristic value in the hydrogen environment with the preset pressure and the preset temperature, safety evaluation of the metal material simulated hydrogen conveying pipeline under the fatigue load working condition is completed. The fatigue crack test is replaced by the fracture toughness test according to the defect length, the fatigue and fracture cooperative test is realized, the sample replacement is not needed, the test material is saved, the test preparation time for the sample replacement and cooling process is reduced, and the test efficiency is improved.

本发明涉及一种氢环境金属材料疲劳和断裂协同试验与评价方法及系统，属于金属材料临氢环境相容性领域。方法包括对疲劳与断裂协同试验试样进行预设压力预设温度氢环境下疲劳裂纹扩展试验和断裂韧性试验；基于所得的疲劳裂纹扩展曲线和所得的裂纹扩展阻力曲线，得预设压力预设温度氢环境中疲劳裂纹扩展拟合曲线和断裂韧性特征值；基于预设压力预设温度氢环境中疲劳裂纹扩展拟合曲线和断裂韧性特征值，完成金属材料模拟输氢管道在疲劳载荷工况下的安全评价。本发明根据缺陷长度替换疲劳裂纹试验为断裂韧性试验，实现了疲劳与断裂协同试验，无需进行试样跟换，不但节省了试验材料，减少了试样更换及降温过程等试验准备时间，提高了试验效率。

invention_title.text: Full-size PE pipeline hydrogen permeation and aging test integrated equipment
一种全尺寸PE管道氢渗透及老化测试一体化设备

extracted_name.value: 北京市燃气集团有限责任公司

abstract.text: The utility model discloses full-size PE pipeline hydrogen permeation and aging test integrated equipment which comprises a high-temperature aging oven, supporting plates are fixedly installed at the two ends of the bottom of an inner cavity of the high-temperature aging oven, a sealing mechanism used for testing is arranged at the tops of the supporting plates, and a PE pipe body is arranged on the inner side wall of the sealing mechanism; according to the utility model, the high-temperature aging oven, the sealing mechanism, the air intake and exhaust mechanism, the pressure reading instrument and the gas chromatograph are arranged in a matched manner, so that the hydrogen permeability of the full-size PE pipeline can be tested, and meanwhile, an aging test can be carried out in a hydrogen environment, thereby improving the test effect; the hydrogen permeability coefficient of hydrogen-doped natural gas in a PE pipeline can be measured through gas chromatography, so that the requirements of people are met, sealing operation during testing is achieved through the sealing mechanism, the gas inlet and outlet mechanism is used for achieving gas inlet and outlet operation during testing, and the pressure reading instrument and the gas chromatograph are used for analyzing and recording obtained data.

本实用新型公开了一种全尺寸PE管道氢渗透及老化测试一体化设备，包括高温老化箱，所述高温老化箱内腔底部的两端均固定安装有支板，所述支板的顶部设置有用于测试的密封机构，所述密封机构的内侧壁设置有PE管本体；本实用新型通过高温老化箱、密封机构、进排气机构、读压仪和气相色谱仪的配合设置，能够对全尺寸PE管道的氢渗透性能进行测试，同时还可在临氢环境中进行老化测试，从而提高测试的效果，可以通过气相色谱测量掺氢天然气在PE管道中的氢渗透系数的优点吗，以满足人们的需求，利用密封机构实现测试时的密封作业，而进排气机构用于实现测试时的进排气作业，读压仪和气相色谱仪实现分析以及记录所得数据。

abstract.text: The invention provides a rock salt creep experiment device in a high-pressure hydrogen environment, and belongs to the technical field of rock experiments, the rock salt creep experiment device comprises a cavity, the top and the side of the cavity are provided with openings, a top cover and a side cover, the top cover and the side cover are used for sealing the two openings respectively, and the side cover is provided with an observation window; an air injection hole and an exhaust hole are formed in one side, deviating from the side cover, of the side wall of the cavity, and the air injection hole is higher than the exhaust hole; the experiment assembling structure is arranged in the cavity, and the experiment assembling structure comprises a sample placing table, a limiting assembly and a loading rod; the gas injection and recovery system is arranged on one side of the cavity and used for injecting high-pressure hydrogen into the cavity and recovering the high-pressure hydrogen in the cavity; and the shooting system is arranged on one side where the side cover of the cavity is located and comprises a shooting device and a light source. By means of the salt rock creep experiment device in the high-pressure hydrogen environment, the safety of the experiment device can be improved, and potential safety hazards caused by the circuit and air tightness problems are reduced.

本申请提供一种高压氢环境下的盐岩蠕变实验装置，属于岩石实验技术领域，包括：腔体，腔体的顶部和侧部具有开口以及分别用于封闭两个开口的顶盖和侧盖，且侧盖上设置有观察窗口，腔体的侧壁上位于背离侧盖的一侧开设有注气孔和排气孔，注气孔的高度高于排气孔；实验装配结构，设置在腔体内，实验装配结构包括置样台、限位组件和加载杆；注气回收系统，设置在腔体的一侧，用于向腔体内注入高压氢气以及回收腔体内的高压氢气；拍摄系统，设置在腔体的侧盖所在的一侧，包括摄影装置和光源。通过本申请提供的一种高压氢环境下的盐岩蠕变实验装置，可以提升实验装置的安全性，减少因电路以及气密性问题导致的潜在安全隐患。

abstract.text: Provided is a method for manufacturing an austenitic alloy steel material that can improve mechanical properties even without improving a composition of a steel material and 5 an increase in the service life of a component in a high-pressure hydrogen environment can be expected. A method for manufacturing a precipitation-hardening austenitic alloy steel material, the method including: a hot forging step of providing a material for forging having a composition of the precipitation-hardening austenitic alloy steel material, and performing hot forging several times so that a total forging forming ratio is 30 or more, to form a forged 10 material. The method preferably includes a heat treatment step of additionally subjecting the forged material to a solution treatment and an aging treatment, to obtain a heat-treated steel material.

abstract.text: The invention relates to the technical field of ultrahigh-speed motor materials and hydrogen energy equipment, in particular to a high-performance material combination for an ultrahigh-speed permanent magnet motor driven hydrogen circulating pump, which comprises a permanent magnet material: a neodymium iron boron 42SH magnet is adopted and subjected to Dy-Cu co-doping treatment, and the surface of the magnet is coated with a nickel-phosphorus alloy coating of 10-15 microns; the rotor sheath is made of TC11 titanium alloy (containing 3.5%-4.5% of Mo), and the hardness of the TC11 titanium alloy reaches 38-42 HRC after beta heat treatment; a pump body and an impeller are made of a combined structure of Hastelloy C276 and a SiC particle reinforced aluminum matrix composite (the volume fraction of SiC is 15%-20%), and the inner wall of the pump body is sprayed with a 50-80-micron diamond-like carbon (DLC) coating; hydrogen embrittlement resistance and stability are enhanced, the hydrogen embrittlement critical value of a key material is increased to 200 MPa.m < 1/2 > or above, and the continuous operation life under the 1.5 MPa hydrogen environment is longer than or equal to 8000 h and is prolonged by two times compared with a traditional material; the high-temperature magnetic performance attenuation rate of the permanent magnet is smaller than or equal to 5%, the fatigue strength of the rotor sheath is improved by 25%, and the requirement for long-term operation at the speed of 200000r/min is met.

本申请涉及超高速电机材料与氢能装备技术领域，具体为一种用于超高速永磁电机驱动氢气循环泵的高性能材料组合，包括永磁体材料：采用钕铁硼42SH磁体，经Dy‑Cu共掺杂处理，磁体表面包覆10‑15μm镍‑磷合金镀层；转子护套材料：选用TC11钛合金(含Mo3.5％‑4.5％)，经β热处理后硬度达38‑42HRC；泵体及叶轮材料：采用哈氏合金C276与SiC颗粒增强铝基复合材料(SiC体积分数15％‑20％)的组合结构，泵体内壁喷涂50‑80μm类金刚石(DLC)涂层；抗氢脆与稳定性增强：关键材料氢脆临界值提升至200MPa·m1/2以上，1.5MPa氢气环境下连续运行寿命≥8000h，较传统材料延长2倍；磁‑力性能衰减可控：永磁体高温磁性能衰减率≤5％，转子护套疲劳强度提升25％，满足200000r/min长期运行需求。

abstract.text: The invention relates to the technical field of motor iron core structures, in particular to a hydrogen circulating pump stator iron core structure adopting 0.05 mm silicon steel sheets. The hydrogen circulating pump stator iron core structure adopting 0.05 mm silicon steel sheets comprises an iron core body which is formed by laminating a plurality of silicon steel sheets with the thickness of 0.05 mm in the axial direction, and the surfaces of the silicon steel sheets are provided with insulating coatings; the stator yoke part is located on the periphery of the iron core body and is of an annular structure, and the thickness of the yoke part is 15-20 mm; the stator tooth parts are uniformly distributed along the inner circumference of the stator yoke part, the number of the stator tooth parts is 12-24, the width of each tooth part is 5-8mm, and a wire slot is formed between every two adjacent tooth parts; the eddy current path is shortened by the ultra-thin silicon steel sheets of 0.05 mm, and the high-frequency iron loss is reduced by more than 40% and the motor efficiency is improved by 5-8% by combining high-frequency low-loss materials; and the heat dissipation grooves and the graphene heat-conducting fins have a synergistic effect, so that the temperature rise of the iron core is reduced by 15-20 DEG C, and high-temperature potential safety hazards in a hydrogen environment are avoided.

本申请涉及电机铁芯结构技术领域，具体为一种采用0.05毫米硅钢片的氢气循环泵定子铁芯结构，一种采用0.05毫米硅钢片的氢气循环泵定子铁芯结构，包括铁芯本体：由多片厚度为0.05mm的硅钢片沿轴向叠压而成，所述硅钢片表面设有绝缘涂层；定子轭部：位于铁芯本体外周，呈环形结构，轭部厚度为15‑20mm；定子齿部：沿定子轭部内圆周均匀分布，数量为12‑24个，齿部宽度为5‑8mm，相邻齿部之间形成线槽；高频铁损显著降低：0.05mm超薄硅钢片缩短涡流路径，结合高频低损耗材质，高频下铁损降低40％以上，电机效率提升5％‑8％；散热性能增强：散热槽与石墨烯导热片协同作用，铁芯温升降低15‑20℃，避免氢气环境下的高温安全隐患。

abstract.text: The invention relates to the technical field of compressor cylinder body surface coating, and discloses a high-pressure piston type hydrogen compressor cylinder body surface PVD preparation process which comprises the following steps: step 1, matrix laser microtexturing and plasma activation: machining micro-pit arrays on the surfaces of a cylinder sleeve and a piston by adopting a pulse fiber laser; and the oxide layer is removed through Ar < + >/H2 mixed plasma etching, and a nanoscale activated surface is generated. According to the method, the film-substrate binding force is remarkably enhanced through laser microtexture and plasma activation, and the coating is prevented from being peeled off; by utilizing a multi-layer composite structure and a rare earth doping technology, the coating structure is extremely densified, a hydrogen permeation path is effectively blocked, and hydrogen embrittlement is fundamentally inhibited; gradient design and fluorinated hydrophobic treatment are adopted, so that the surface is endowed with low friction coefficient and super-hydrophobicity, and abrasion and corrosion are reduced; meanwhile, high hardness, high toughness and excellent corrosion resistance are considered, and the reliability, durability and safety of the cylinder body in the high-pressure hydrogen environment are comprehensively improved.

本发明涉及压缩机缸体表面镀层技术领域，公开了一种高压活塞式氢气压缩机缸体表面PVD的制备工艺，包括以下步骤，步骤1、基体激光微织构与等离子活化：采用脉冲光纤激光器在缸套和活塞表面加工微凹坑阵列；并通过Ar+/H2混合等离子体刻蚀去除氧化层并生成纳米级活化表面。本发明通过激光微织构与等离子活化显著增强膜基结合力，防止涂层剥落；利用多层复合结构及稀土掺杂技术，极致致密化涂层结构，有效阻断氢渗透路径，从根本上抑制氢脆；采用梯度设计与氟化疏水处理，赋予表面低摩擦系数和超疏水性，减少磨损与腐蚀；同时兼顾高硬度、高韧性及优异耐腐蚀性，全面提升缸体在高压氢气环境下的可靠性、耐久性与安全性。

invention_title.text: Multiphase preparation method of aniline derivative
一种苯胺衍生物的多相制备方法

abstract.text: The invention belongs to the technical field of fine chemicals and related chemistry, and provides a heterogeneous preparation method of an aniline derivative, which comprises the following steps: taking a nitrobenzene derivative as a raw material, and reacting in an organic solvent at 60-100 DEG C for 24 hours in a hydrogen environment under the action of a high-entropy alloy catalyst to obtain the corresponding aniline derivative. According to the method, the high-entropy alloy is used as the catalyst, the reaction selectivity is high, the reaction system is simple, the substrate compatibility is good, the highest yield can reach 97% or above, and the catalyst is good in stability and can be recycled. The aniline derivative prepared by the invention has a wide range of applications, and has an extremely important position in drug design and drug synthesis.

本发明属于精细化学品及相关化学技术领域，提供了一种苯胺衍生物的多相制备方法，该方法以硝基苯衍生物为原料，氢气环境下，在高熵合金催化剂的作用下，于有机溶剂中，在60‑100 °C反应24小时，即得到相应的苯胺衍生物。本发明的方法使用高熵合金作为催化剂，反应选择性高，反应的体系简单，底物兼容性好，最高产率可达97%以上，催化剂稳定性好、可回收利用。本发明制备的苯胺衍生物具有相当广泛的用途，在药物设计和药物合成中具有极其重要地位。

abstract.text: The invention relates to intelligent agent test equipment for intelligently and efficiently evaluating the fatigue crack growth rate of hydrogen pipeline steel and a use method of the intelligent agent test equipment. The problem that the fatigue crack growth rate test efficiency of a material is low under the gaseous hydrogen environment and the fatigue coupling effect is solved. The equipment mainly comprises a high-purity N2 gas cylinder, a high-purity H2 gas cylinder, a hydrogen-doped gas cylinder I, a hydrogen-doped gas cylinder II, an electromagnetic valve I, an electromagnetic valve II, an electromagnetic valve III, an electromagnetic valve IV, a gas inlet pipeline, a vacuum pump, a vacuum gauge, a pressure gauge, a high-pressure hydrogen environment fatigue crack growth rate performance test system and an artificial intelligence decision and control system. Multi-field coupling conditions such as stress amplitude, frequency, pressure and hydrogen doping ratio can be integrated, and the crack propagation behavior of a pipeline steel material in an actual hydrogen service environment can be simulated. A direct-current potential drop device is used for monitoring the fatigue crack propagation state in real time, an artificial intelligence model is embedded at the same time, and load, environment and crack data collected in real time are subjected to online analysis.

本发明涉及一种临氢管线钢疲劳裂纹扩展速率智能化高效评价的智能体试验设备及其使用方法，解决材料在气态氢气环境与疲劳耦合作用下疲劳裂纹扩展速率测试效率低的问题。该设备主要由高纯N2气瓶、高纯H2气瓶、掺氢气瓶Ⅰ、掺氢气瓶Ⅱ、电磁阀Ⅰ、电磁阀Ⅱ、电磁阀Ⅲ、电磁阀Ⅳ、进气管路、真空泵、真空计、压力表、高压氢环境疲劳裂纹扩展速率性能测试系统、人工智能决策和控制系统组成，能够集成应力幅、频率、压力、掺氢比等多场耦合条件，模拟管线钢材料在实际临氢服役环境下的裂纹扩展行为。使用直流电位降装置实时监测疲劳裂纹扩展状态，同时嵌入人工智能模型，对实时采集的载荷、环境、裂纹数据进行在线分析。

abstract.text: The invention relates to an active inking system (1) which is fixed to the paying module (25) of self-service equipment. Said system includes a modification in the upper cover (4) of the cassette (24), where three upper holes (5) and one front hole (6) are made; the upper holes (5) fix the spreader assembly (2) and the front hole (6) receives the male quick coupler (13) through which the ink (29) enters. The system (1) comprises a spark sensor (14), component fixing structure (12), male quick coupler (13), ink cylinders (15), screws (16), ink outlet connections (20), actuating trigger (17), CO2 gas cylinders (18), tubes (19) and connections (21) for compressed gas. The spreader assembly (2) comprises a tank (10) aligned with the front opening (6) of the top cover (4) of the cassette (24), the tank (10) in communication with the spreader tube (8) equipped with holes (9) directed to the notes (7) through which the ink (29) is ejected for marking them. The sparks (27) activate the spark sensor (14) that activates the trigger (17), breaks the seal (28) of the CO2 cylinder (18), pressurizes the tubes for compressed gas (19), moves the front (22) and rear (23) pistons and pushes the ink (29).

Se describe un sistema de entintado activo (1) fijado al módulo pagador (25) de los equipos de autoservicio. Dicho sistema incluye una modificación em la tapa superior (4) del casete (24), donde se hace tres orificios superiores (5) y un orificio frontal (6); los orificios superiores (5) fijan el conjunto esparcidor (2) y el orificio frontal (6) recibe el acoplador rápido macho (13) por donde entra la tinta (29). El sistema (1) comprende un sensor de chispa (14), estructura de fijación de componentes (12), acoplador rápido macho (13), cilindros de tinta (15), tornillos (16), conexiones de salida de tinta (20), gatillo de accionamiento (17), cilindros de gas CO2 (18), tubos (19) y conexiones (21) para gas comprimido. El conjunto esparcidor (2) comprende un tanque (10) alineado con el orificio frontal (6) de la tapa superior (4) del casete (24), el tanque (10) en comunicación con el tubo esparcidor (8) equipado con agujeros (9) dirigidos a los billetes (7) por donde se expulsa la tinta (29) para marcarlos. Las chispas (27) activan el sensor de chispa (14) que activa el gatillo (17), rompe el sello (28) del cilindro de CO2 (18), presuriza los tubos para gas comprimido (19), mueve los émbolos frontales (22) y trasero (23) y empuja la tinta (29).

abstract.text: The present disclosure provides shared circuitry configurations that may be implemented in a plasma generation system to improve control over application of electrical energy to a plasma generator, thereby providing improved performance. In some embodiments, shared circuitry configurations described herein may be implemented to improve performance of a traveling spark igniter that is configured to generate and propagate plasma using a Lorentz force and a thermal force, such as by applying electrical energy to electrodes of a plasma generator following breakdown between the electrodes. Other plasma generator configurations may also benefit from the circuitry configurations described herein.

La présente divulgation concerne des configurations de circuiterie partagée qui peuvent être mises en œuvre dans un système de génération de plasma pour améliorer la maîtrise de l'application d'énergie électrique à un générateur de plasma, ce qui permet d'obtenir des performances améliorées. Selon certains modes de réalisation, des configurations de circuiterie partagée décrites dans la description peuvent être mises en œuvre pour améliorer les performances d'un allumeur à étincelle mobile qui est configuré pour générer et propager un plasma à l'aide d'une force de Lorentz et d'une force thermique, par exemple par application d'énergie électrique à des électrodes d'un générateur de plasma à la suite d'un claquage entre les électrodes. D'autres configurations de générateur de plasma peuvent également bénéficier des configurations de circuiterie décrites dans la description.

abstract.text: An electrostatic discharge trap device for protecting a water-resistant microphone from electrostatic discharge may include a conductive material positioned between a microphone port and a microphone venting stack-up to prevent liquid entry into the microphone, wherein the electrostatic discharge trap device is configured to receive an electric spark from the microphone port and conduct the electric spark away from the microphone venting stack-up to a conductive layer.

invention_title.text: INTRAVASCULAR LITHOTRIPSY CATHETER WITH OMNI-DIRECTIONAL SHOCK WAVE EMITTERS

abstract.text: An exemplary catheter for generating shock waves includes a catheter body; an enclosure mounted to the catheter body; an emitter band positioned at least partially around the catheter body and within the enclosure; and at least three electrodes positioned adjacent to the emitter band and spaced apart from the emitter band by respective spark gaps, the at least three electrodes together with the emitter band forming electrode pairs of at least three shock wave emitters of the emitter band, wherein at least one of the at least three shock wave emitters can be driven separately from at least one other of the at least three shock wave emitters.

invention_title.text: CATHÉTER DE LITHOTRIPSIE INTRAVASCULAIRE À ÉMETTEURS D'ONDES DE CHOC OMNIDIRECTIONNELS
INTRAVASCULAR LITHOTRIPSY CATHETER WITH OMNI-DIRECTIONAL SHOCK WAVE EMITTERS

abstract.text: An exemplary catheter for generating shock waves includes a catheter body; an enclosure mounted to the catheter body; an emitter band positioned at least partially around the catheter body and within the enclosure; and at least three electrodes positioned adjacent to the emitter band and spaced apart from the emitter band by respective spark gaps, the at least three electrodes together with the emitter band forming electrode pairs of at least three shock wave emitters of the emitter band, wherein at least one of the at least three shock wave emitters can be driven separately from at least one other of the at least three shock wave emitters.

Un cathéter donné à titre d'exemple permettant de générer des ondes de choc comprend un corps de cathéter ; une enceinte montée sur le corps de cathéter ; une bande émettrice positionnée au moins partiellement autour du corps de cathéter et à l'intérieur de l'enceinte ; et au moins trois électrodes positionnées adjacentes à la bande émettrice et espacées de la bande émettrice par des éclateurs respectifs, lesdites au moins trois électrodes formant conjointement avec la bande émettrice des paires d'électrodes d'au moins trois émetteurs d'ondes de choc de la bande émettrice, au moins l'un desdits au moins trois émetteurs d'ondes de choc pouvant être commandé séparément d'au moins un autre desdits au moins trois émetteurs d'ondes de choc.

invention_title.text: PROCÉDÉ DE COMMUNICATION ET APPAREIL DE COMMUNICATION
COMMUNICATION METHOD AND COMMUNICATION APPARATUS
通信方法和通信装置

abstract.text: The present application provides a communication method and a communication apparatus, applied to the field of communications. The technical solution of the present application can support IEEE protocols, such as IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT protocol, IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8 protocol, Integrated mmWave/integrated millimeter wave/IMMW protocol, IEEE 802.15/UWB protocol, IEEE 802.11bf/sensing protocol, or spark link/nearlink standard protocol. In the technical solution of the present application, sensing devices indicate relative position acquisition related information, thereby facilitating acquisition of the relative position between the sensing devices, improvement of the accuracy of a sensing result and the flexibility of sensing device deployment, and broadening of the range of application scenarios of sensing measurement.

La présente demande concerne un procédé de communication et un appareil de communication, appliqués au domaine des communications. La solution technique selon la présente demande peut prendre en charge des protocoles IEEE, tels que le protocole IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT, le protocole IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8, le protocole mmWave intégrées/ondes millimétriques intégrées/IMMW, le protocole IEEE 802.15/UWB, le protocole IEEE 802.11bf/détection, ou le protocole standard Sparklink/Nearlink. Dans la solution technique de la présente demande, des dispositifs de détection indiquent des informations relatives à l'acquisition de position relative, ce qui facilite l'acquisition de la position relative entre les dispositifs de détection, améliore la précision d'un résultat de détection et la flexibilité du déploiement de dispositifs de détection, et élargit la plage de scénarios d'application de mesure de détection.

本申请提供了通信方法和通信装置，应用于通信领域。本申请的技术方案可以支持IEEE协议，如IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT协议，IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8协议，Integrated mmWave/集成毫米波/IMMW协议，IEEE 802.15/UWB协议，IEEE 802.11bf/sensing/感知协议，或星闪/spark link/nearlink标准协议。本申请的技术方案中，感知设备之间指示相对位置获取相关的信息，有助于获取感知设备之间的相对位置，从而有助于提高感知结果的准确性，提高感知设备部署的灵活性，以及提高感知测量的应用场景的广泛性。

abstract.text: This application relates to an ELR communication method, apparatus and readable storage medium. The method comprises: generating and sending an ELR PPDU. The ELR PPDU comprises a first field, which is generated based on an ELR identification sequence, and the ELR identification sequence is carried on 53 subcarriers whose subcarrier indexes are -26 to 26. The elements of the ELR identification sequence on the subcarriers whose subcarrier indexes are {-24,-20,-16,-12,-8,-4,4,8,12,16,20,24} are all 0. This application can improve the accuracy of packet detection. This application supports IEEE protocols such as 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8, integrated millimeter wave/IMMW, UWB, or Sensing. This application also supports the spark link/spark link/nearlink standard protocol, etc.

invention_title.text: Thermal runaway test system with ignition capability and thermal runaway test method for lithium battery wherein the system comprises a machine body, a test chamber, a cover, a battery test trough, a thermal runaway triggering device, an igniter, and a control device

abstract.text: This invention relates to a thermal runaway test system and thermal runaway test method for lithium batteries. The thermal runaway test system includes a machine body, a test chamber, a cover, a battery test trough, a thermal runaway triggering device, an igniter, and a control device. The test chamber is disposed in the machine body and has a chamber and an opening. The cover is movable between a closed position and an open position. The battery test trough is located in the chamber and is used for placing a lithium battery. The thermal runaway triggering device is controllable to apply at least one trigger to the lithium battery. An ignition end of the igniter extends into the chamber. The control device is electrically connected to the thermal runaway triggering device and the igniter. The control device controls the thermal runaway triggering device to generate the at least one trigger, and controls the ignition end of the igniter to generate a spark in the chamber.

abstract.text: The present disclosure provides shared circuitry configurations that may be implemented in a plasma generation system to improve control over application of electrical energy to a plasma generator, thereby providing improved performance. In some embodiments, shared circuitry configurations described herein may be implemented to improve performance of a traveling spark igniter that is configured to generate and propagate plasma using a Lorentz force and a thermal force, such as by applying electrical energy to electrodes of a plasma generator following breakdown between the electrodes. Other plasma generator configurations may also benefit from the circuitry configurations described herein.

abstract.text: The invention discloses a low-temperature sintering preparation process for fine-grained molybdenum alloy. A hydrothermal method is adopted to prepare MoO3 and ZrC precursors respectively. The two suspensions after hydrothermal treatment are mixed and fully stirred by liquid-liquid doping. The precursors of micron-grade MoO3 and nano-grade ZrC are obtained by filtering and freeze-drying. The preparation process adopts a hydrothermal method. The molybdenum alloy prepared by this process can be sintered at a relatively low temperature to obtain relatively fine grains. Compared with the traditional high-temperature sintering process, spark plasma sintering has a low temperature and a short time, which can reduce energy consumption and improve the economy and sustainability of the preparation. At the same time, liquid-liquid doping can make the MoO3 and ZrC precursors uniformly dispersed in the aqueous solution, realize the uniform distribution of the second phase in the fine-grained molybdenum alloy, and then improve the consistency and stability of the material performance. In addition, the prepared molybdenum alloy has a smaller grain size, usually at the nanometer to micrometer level, which can improve the overall mechanical properties of the material.

invention_title.text: Methods for Forming Parts by Spark Plasma Sintering and Additive Manufacturing

extracted_name.value: SAN DIEGO STATE UNIV SDSU FOUNDATION DBA SAN DIEGO STATE UNIV RESEARCH FOUNDATION [US]
San Diego State University (SDSU) Foundation, DBA San Diego State University Research Foundation

abstract.text: Methods and apparatus for manufacturing a sintered powder manufactured item having an inhomogeneous internal and/or external geometry is provided. Processes and apparatus may comprise fabricating a sacrificial mold to be placed in a sintering die to create a sintering assembly, where the sintering assembly has a geometrically uniform external contour and defines an inner volume having at least one fillable space that is geometrically inhomogeneous. The part material is selected to have a lower sintering temperature than the at least one mold material such that when sintering the filled sintering assembly at a sintering temperature the at least one mold material remains un-sintered and at least one powder part material sinters to form a sinter manufactured item having a shape defined by the inner volume of the sintering assembly.

abstract.text: An in-line separator for reducing sparks from grinding, welding, cutting, and other industrial applications. The in-line separator provides spark reduction, reduces damage to filter media, has minimal pressure drop, zero footprint, easy installation, and operates in a vertical or horizontal position. The in-line separator removes filter media and other elements in airflow by using cyclonic motion to cause the filter media and other airflow elements to drop out of the airflow.

abstract.text: The invention relates to a furnace made from structural carbon steel and stainless steel designed for the curing of electrostatic paint in gas cylinders of 20 kg and 30 kg. It is conditioned to work continuously using an overhead conveyor rail (3) to feed and translate the gas cylinders. It has 24 infrared panels (18) of metal fibres to LP or natural gas in addition to programmable temperature control, flame control, spark for ignition and flame modulation system.

La presente invención provee un horno fabricado en acero al carbón estructural y acero inoxidable diseñado para el curado de pintura electrostática en cilindros de gas de 20 kg y 30 kg. Está acondicionado para trabajar de manera continua utilizando un riel transportador aéreo (3) para alimentar y trasladar los cilindros gas. Cuenta con 24 paneles infrarrojos (18) de fibras metálicas a gas LP o natural además de control de temperatura programable, control de flama, chispa para encendido y sistema de modulación de flama.

abstract.text: The present disclosure provides plasma generation techniques that may be implemented to maintain plasma coherence, resulting in high performance and long useful life of components, and which are suitable for use in a low-pressure environment (e.g., as in some aerospace applications) but are not limited thereto. In some embodiments, plasma generation and coherence maintaining techniques may be implemented to improve construction and/or operation of a traveling spark igniter that is configured to generate and propagate plasma using a Lorentz force and thermal force.

La présente divulgation concerne des techniques de génération de plasma qui peuvent être mises en œuvre pour maintenir une cohérence de plasma, ce qui permet d'obtenir une performance élevée et une longue durée de vie utile de composants, et qui sont appropriés pour être utilisés dans un environnement à basse pression (par exemple, comme dans certaines applications aérospatiales) mais ne sont pas limités à ceux-ci. Dans certains modes de réalisation, des techniques de génération de plasma et de maintien de cohérence peuvent être mises en œuvre pour améliorer la construction et/ou le fonctionnement d'un allumeur à étincelle mobile qui est configuré pour générer et propager un plasma à l'aide d'une force de Lorentz et d'une force thermique.

abstract.text: The invention relates to a cartridge for an entangling projectile. The technical result is the creation of a firing cartridge structure that has smaller dimensions by comparison with the prior art, can be more easily reloaded with a charge and projectiles, does not require a casing with a launching device, can be used with the most effective non-lethal remote electroshock weapon and makes it possible to obtain a synergistic effect with the action of the non-lethal weapon. The claimed cartridge comprises a casing with internal barrel channels which are arranged at a horizontal angle to one another and are vertically offset from one another, probes with barbed hooks, and a tether connecting the probes and being packed into an internal cavity of the casing. The cartridge further comprises a cover or a rupture disc. The barrel channels contain electrically activated pyrotechnic propellant charges arranged in the body of the probes or in the barrel channels themselves. The casing has a point for attachment to an electroshock weapon or to an adapter of an electroshock weapon, with contact points of the electrically activated pyrotechnic propellant charges of the probes or barrel channels being externalized on the outside surface of the casing. The probe or barrel channel charges are activated by bridge-type, conduction-type or spark-type electrical ignition.

L'invention concerne une cartouche pour moyen de jet d'entraves. Le résultat technique consiste en la création d'une structure de cartouche de tir ayant des dimensions réduites par rapport au prototype, avec une simplification du réarmement et du rechargement avec une charge et des ogives, qui ne nécessite pas de corps avec un dispositif de mise à feu et que l'on utilise à l'aide d'une arme non létale (ANL) plus efficace à choc électrique distant, et permettant d'obtenir un effet synergique de l'action de l'ANL. Cette cartouche comprend un corps avec des canaux de fûts internes disposés à un angle horizontal l'un par rapport à l'autre et et selon un décalage vertical l'un par rapport à l'autre. Elle comprend des sondes avec des crochets comprenant des barbes et un filin de connexion des sondes reliant les sondes à un boîtier de filin dans la cavité interne du corps. La cartouche comprend également un couvercle ou une membrane frangible. Les canaux de fûts comprennent des charges pyrotechniques propulsées à déclenchement électrique, disposées dans le corps des sondes ou dans les canaux de fûts proprement dits. Le corps comprend un endroit pour la connexion à une arme à chocs électriques ou à un adaptateur d'arme à chocs électriques avec des sorties d'endroits de contact de charges pyrotechniques propulsées à déclenchement électrique de sondes ou de canaux de fûts sur la surface externe du corps. Les charges des sondes ou des canaux de fûts sont actionnées par un allumage électrique à pontet, conducteur de courant ou à étincelle.

﻿Изобретение относится к картриджу опутывающего метательного средства. Техническим результатом является создание конструкции стреляющего картриджа уменьшенных по сравнению с прототипом габаритов, с упрощением переоснащения зарядом и снарядами, не нуждающегося в корпусе с пусковым устройством и использующегося при помощи наиболее эффективного ОНД дистанционного электрошокера и позволяющего получить синергетический эффект воздействия ОНД. Картридж содержит корпус с внутренними ствольными каналами, расположенными под горизонтальным углом друг к другу и вертикальным смещением друг от друга. Зонды с крючками имеющие бородки и соединительный трос зондов соединяющий зонды с укладкой троса во внутренней полости корпуса. Также картридж содержит крышку или разрывную мембрану. Ствольные каналы содержат метательные пиротехнические заряды с электроинициированием, расположенные в теле зондов, или самих ствольных каналах. Корпус имеет место для присоединения к электрошоковому оружию или переходнику электрошокового оружия с выводами контактных мест метательных пиротехнических зарядов электроинициирования зондов или ствольных каналов на наружную поверхность корпуса. Заряды зондов или ствольных каналов инициируются мостиковым, токопроводным или искровым типом электровоспламенения.

abstract.text: Provided is a long-life composite battery pack in which spark countermeasures at the time of opening/closing a switch are taken into consideration. A composite battery pack 10 comprises a plurality of battery packs 12, an integrated battery management system 14, and a lead storage battery pack 16. Each of the plurality of battery packs 12 incorporates a plurality of lithium-ion batteries 12a, and further comprises a contactor switch 12c. The lead storage battery pack 16 is connected in parallel to the plurality of battery packs 12. The integrated battery management system 14 performs control to open the contactor switch 12c of a first battery pack when the voltage of the first battery pack deviates from a predetermined operation voltage range, and to close the contactor switch 12c of a second battery pack when a relationship between a voltage difference ΔV between the second battery pack and the lead storage battery pack 16, a maximum electric current Imax that can flow through the second battery pack, and an internal resistance R of the second battery pack satisfy formula (1).

L'invention concerne un bloc-batterie composite à longue durée de vie dans lequel des contre-mesures d'étincelle au moment de l'ouverture/fermeture d'un commutateur sont prises en considération. Le bloc-batterie composite (10) comprend une pluralité de blocs-batteries (12), un système intégré de gestion de batteries (14) et un bloc-batterie d'accumulateurs au plomb (16). Chacun de la pluralité des blocs-batteries (12) incorpore une pluralité de batteries au lithium-ion (12a), et comprend en outre un interrupteur à contacteur (12c). Le bloc-batterie d'accumulateurs au plomb (16) est connecté en parallèle à la pluralité des blocs-batteries (12). Le système intégré de gestion de batteries (14) effectue une commande pour ouvrir l'interrupteur à contacteur (12c) d'un premier bloc-batterie lorsque la tension du premier bloc-batterie s'écarte d'une plage de tensions de fonctionnement prédéfinie, et pour fermer l'interrupteur à contacteur (12c) d'un second bloc-batterie lorsqu'une relation entre la différence de tension (ΔV) entre le second bloc-batterie et le bloc-batterie d'accumulateurs au plomb (16), un courant électrique maximal (Imax) pouvant circuler à travers le second bloc-batterie, et une résistance interne (R) du second bloc-batterie satisfont la formule (1).

スイッチを開閉時のスパーク対策が考慮されている長寿命な複合電池パックを提供する。複合電池パック１０は、複数の電池パック１２と統合型バッテリーマネジメントシステム１４と鉛蓄電池パック１６とを備える。複数の電池パック１２のそれぞれは、複数のリチウムイオン電池１２ａを内蔵し、さらに、コンタクタースイッチ１２ｃを備える。鉛蓄電池パック１６は、複数の電池パック１２に並列に接続される。統合型バッテリーマネジメントシステム１４は、第１電池パックの電圧が、あらかじめ規定した作動電圧範囲を逸脱した場合に、第１電池パックのコンタクタースイッチ１２ｃを開くように制御し、第２電池パックと鉛蓄電池パック１６との電圧差ΔＶ、第２電池パックが流すことができる最大電流Ｉｍａｘおよび第２電池パックの内部抵抗Ｒの関係が式（１）を満たすようになった時点で、第２電池パックのコンタクタースイッチ１２ｃを閉じるように制御する。

abstract.text: Provided is a long-life composite battery pack in which a spark countermeasure at the time of opening a switch is taken into consideration. A composite battery pack 10 comprises a plurality of battery packs 12, an integrated battery management system 14, and a lead storage battery pack 16. Each of the plurality of battery packs 12 incorporates a plurality of lithium-ion batteries 12a and further includes a contactor switch 12c. The lead storage battery pack 16 is connected in parallel with the plurality of battery packs 12. The integrated battery management system 14 performs control so as to open the contactor switch 12c of a specific battery pack 12 when the voltage of the specific battery pack 12 deviates from a predetermined operation voltage range, and performs control so as to close the contactor switch 12c when the voltage difference ΔV between the plurality of battery packs 12 and the lead storage battery pack 16 is a voltage difference less than the product value of the maximum current I which can be made to flow by each battery pack 12 and the internal resistance R of each battery pack 12.

L'invention concerne un bloc-batterie composite à longue durée de vie dans lequel une contre-mesure d'étincelle au moment de l'ouverture d'un commutateur est prise en considération. Un bloc-batterie composite (10) comprend une pluralité de blocs-batteries (12), un système de gestion de batterie intégré (14) et un bloc-batterie de stockage au plomb (16). Chacun de la pluralité de blocs-batteries (12) incorpore une pluralité de batteries au lithium-ion (12a) et comprend en outre un commutateur de contacteur (12c). Le bloc-batterie de stockage au plomb (16) est connecté en parallèle à la pluralité de blocs-batteries (12). Le système de gestion de batterie intégré (14) effectue une commande de façon à ouvrir le commutateur de contacteur (12c) d'un bloc-batterie spécifique (12) lorsque la tension du bloc-batterie spécifique (12) s'écarte d'une plage de tension de fonctionnement prédéterminée, et effectue une commande de façon à fermer le commutateur de contacteur (12c) lorsque la différence de tension ΔV entre la pluralité de blocs-batteries (12) et le bloc-batterie de stockage au plomb (16) est une différence de tension inférieure à la valeur du produit du courant maximal I qui peut être amené à circuler par chaque bloc-batterie (12) et la résistance interne R de chaque bloc-batterie (12).

スイッチを開く時のスパーク対策が考慮されている長寿命な複合電池パックを提供する。複合電池パック１０は、複数の電池パック１２と統合型バッテリーマネジメントシステム１４と鉛蓄電池パック１６とを備える。複数の電池パック１２のそれぞれは、複数のリチウムイオン電池１２ａを内蔵し、さらに、コンタクタースイッチ１２ｃを備える。鉛蓄電池パック１６は、複数の電池パック１２に並列に接続される。統合型バッテリーマネジメントシステム１４は、特定の電池パック１２の電圧が、あらかじめ規定してある作動電圧範囲を逸脱した場合に、特定の電池パック１２のコンタクタースイッチ１２ｃを開くように制御し、複数の電池パック１２と鉛蓄電池パック１６との電圧差ΔＶが、各電池パック１２が流すことができる最大電流Ｉと各電池パック１２の内部抵抗Ｒとの積の値未満であるような電圧差の時にコンタクタースイッチ１２ｃを閉じるように制御する。

abstract.text: Apparatus includes a substrate, a metal layer over the substrate, and a passivation layer over the metal layer. The metal layer includes a first metal portion coupled to a first bond pad and having a first terminal end and a second metal portion coupled to a second bond pad and having a second terminal end spaced from the first terminal end by a gap configured to form a spark gap between the first terminal end and the second terminal end. The apparatus may additionally or alternatively include a first die having a first ground contact and a first Through Silicon Via (TSV) and a second die having a second ground contact that is galvanically isolated from the first ground contact and a second TSV with the first TSV and the second TSV vertically aligned to form a second spark gap between the first die and the second die.

abstract.text: Provided is a microwave oven heating package which is provided with a high-luminance ink layer and an electroconductive heat-generating layer, and in which a steam passage port can be formed through dielectric breakdown and heat generation during microwave oven cooking.　A microwave oven heating package (100) comprises a first sheet member (11) in which a base material layer (12), a sealant layer (13), and an automatic steam-passing mechanism (5) are formed. A high-luminance ink layer (15) and an electroconductive heat-generating layer (16) are formed on the automatic steam-passing mechanism (5) in a superimposed manner. The high-luminance ink layer (15) is made of an ink composition containing a thin-plate flake-like vapor-deposited aluminum pigment in which the aspect ratio of thickness and length is 100-3000. The high-luminance ink layer (15) has formed therein a plurality of non-spark parts configured from island parts, and a spark part configured from a gap part separating the non-spark parts from each other or a bridge part narrower than the island parts. The electroconductive heat-generating layer (16) contains an electroconductive material comprising an organic compound and is layered on at least one of the upper and lower sides of the high-luminance ink layer (15) so as to cover the spark part in plan view.

L'invention concerne un emballage de chauffage au four à micro-ondes qui comprend une couche d'encre à haute luminance et une couche de génération de chaleur électroconductrice, et dans lequel un orifice de passage de vapeur peut être formé par rupture diélectrique et génération de chaleur pendant une cuisson au four à micro-ondes.　L'invention concerne un emballage de chauffage au four à micro-ondes (100) comprenant un premier élément de feuille (11) dans lequel une couche de matériau de base (12), une couche de scellement (13) et un mécanisme de passage de vapeur automatique (5) sont formés. Une couche d'encre à haute luminance (15) et une couche de génération de chaleur électroconductrice (16) sont formées sur le mécanisme de passage de vapeur automatique (5) de manière superposée. La couche d'encre à haute luminance (15) est constituée d'une composition d'encre contenant un pigment lamellaire d'aluminium en plaque mince déposé en phase vapeur, dans lequel le rapport d'aspect de l'épaisseur et de la longueur est de 100 à 3000. La couche d'encre à haute luminance (15) a, formées dans celle-ci, une pluralité de parties ne produisant pas d'étincelle configurées à partir de parties d'îlot, et une partie produisant des étincelles configurée à partir d'une partie d'intervalle séparant les parties ne produisant pas d'étincelle les unes des autres ou une partie de pont plus étroite que les parties d'îlot. La couche de génération de chaleur électroconductrice (16) contient un matériau électroconducteur comprenant un composé organique et est stratifiée sur au moins l'un des côtés supérieur et inférieur de la couche d'encre à haute luminance (15) de façon à recouvrir la partie produisant des étincelles dans une vue en plan.

高輝度インキ層と導電性発熱層を設けて電子レンジ調理の際に絶縁破壊と発熱により蒸通口を形成可能な電子レンジ加熱用包装体を提供する。　電子レンジ加熱用包装体（１００）は基材層（１２）とシーラント層（１３）と自動蒸通機構（５）とが形成された第１シート部材（１１）を備える。自動蒸通機構（５）には高輝度インキ層（１５）と導電性発熱層（１６）とが重畳的に形成される。高輝度インキ層（１５）は、厚みと長さとのアスペクト比が１００～３０００となる薄板フレーク状の蒸着アルミニウム顔料を含んだインキ組成物である。高輝度インキ層（１５）には島部で構成された複数の非スパーク部と、非スパーク部同士を離間する空隙部又は島部より狭い橋部で構成されたスパーク部とが形成される。導電性発熱層（１６）は有機化合物からなる導電性材料を含み、かつ、平面視でスパーク部を覆うように高輝度インキ層（１５）の上下の少なくとも一方に積層される。

abstract.text: The present application relates to the technical field of communications, and specifically to a T-T link establishment method and apparatus. The present application can support IEEE protocols such as IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT protocol, IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8 protocol, IEEE 802.15/UWB protocol, IEEE 802.11bf/sensing protocol, integrated millimeter wave (IMMW) protocol or spark link protocol. In the method, a T node may initiate a T-T link establishment request, wherein the T-T link establishment request may be used for requesting a G node to initiate establishment of a T-T link; upon receiving the T-T link establishment request, the G node may send a T-T link establishment indication to the T node, or may send a T-T link establishment response to the T node. The method can effectively improve the flexibility of T-T link establishment and improve the success rate of T-T link establishment.

La présente demande se rapporte au domaine technique des communications, et concerne spécifiquement un procédé et un appareil d'établissement de liaison T-T. La présente demande peut prendre en charge des protocoles IEEE tels que le protocole IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT, le protocole IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8, le protocole IEEE 802,15/UWB, le protocole IEEE 802.11bf/détection, le protocole d'ondes millimétriques intégré (IMMW) ou le protocole de liaison SparkLink. Dans le procédé, un noeud T peut initier une demande d'établissement de liaison T-T, la demande d'établissement de liaison T-T pouvant être utilisée pour demander à un noeud G d'initier l'établissement d'une liaison T-T; lors de la réception de la demande d'établissement de liaison T-T, le noeud G peut envoyer une indication d'établissement de liaison T-T au noeud T, ou peut envoyer une réponse d'établissement de liaison T-T au noeud T. Le procédé peut améliorer efficacement la flexibilité d'établissement de liaison T-T et améliorer le taux de réussite de l'établissement de liaison T-T.

本申请涉及通信技术领域，尤其涉及一种T-T链路的建立方法及装置。本申请可以支持IEEE协议如IEEE802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT协议，IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8协议，IEEE 802.15/UWB协议，IEEE 802.11bf/感知协议，集成毫米波IMMW协议或星闪协议等。该方法中，可以由T节点发起T-T链路建链请求，该T-T链路建链请求可以用于请求G节点发起T-T链路的建立。G节点接收到该T-T链路建链请求之后，可以向T节点发送T-T链路建链指示，或者可以向T节点发送T-T链路建链响应。该方法可以有效提高T-T链路建立的灵活性，提高T-T链路建立的成功率。

abstract.text: A low-temperature sintering preparation process for a fine-grain molybdenum alloy. The process comprises: preparing a MoO3 precursor and a ZrC precursor respectively by using a hydrothermal method; in a liquid-liquid doping mode, mixing and thoroughly stirring two suspensions, which have been subjected to a hydrothermal treatment; and performing filtration and freeze-drying, so as to obtain a micron-level MoO3 precursor and a nano-level ZrC precursor. The sintering of a molybdenum alloy prepared by means of the preparation process can be implemented at a relatively low temperature, so as to obtain relatively fine grains. Spark plasma sintering involves a low temperature and takes a short time, such that the energy consumption can be reduced, thereby improving the economy and sustainability of the preparation. In addition, liquid-liquid doping enables the MoO3 precursor and the ZrC precursor to be uniformly dispersed in an aqueous solution, thereby realizing the uniform distribution of a second phase in a fine-grain molybdenum alloy, and further improving the consistency and stability of the material performance. Moreover, the prepared molybdenum alloy has a relatively small grain size, which is generally at the nano to micron level, such that the overall mechanical properties of the material can be improved.

L'invention concerne un procédé de préparation de frittage à basse température pour un alliage de molybdène à grains fins. Le procédé comprend : la préparation d'un précurseur de MoO3 et d'un précurseur de ZrC respectivement à l'aide d'un procédé hydrothermique ; dans un mode de dopage liquide-liquide, le mélange et l'agitation complète de deux suspensions, qui ont été soumises à un traitement hydrothermique ; et la réalisation d'une filtration et d'une lyophilisation, de façon à obtenir un précurseur de MoO3 de niveau micrométrique et un précurseur de ZrC de niveau nanométrique. Le frittage d'un alliage de molybdène préparé au moyen du procédé de préparation peut être mis en œuvre à une température relativement basse, de façon à obtenir des grains relativement fins. Le frittage flash implique une basse température et prend un temps court, de telle sorte que la consommation d'énergie peut être réduite, ce qui permet d'améliorer l'économie et la durabilité de la préparation. De plus, un dopage liquide-liquide permet au précurseur de MoO3 et au précurseur de ZrC d'être uniformément dispersés dans une solution aqueuse, ce qui permet de réaliser la distribution uniforme d'une seconde phase dans un alliage de molybdène à grains fins, et d'améliorer davantage la consistance et la stabilité des performances de matériau. De plus, l'alliage de molybdène préparé présente une taille de grain relativement petite, qui est généralement entre un niveau nanométrique et un niveau micrométrique, de telle sorte que les propriétés mécaniques globales du matériau peuvent être améliorées.

一种细晶钼合金的低温烧结制备工艺，采用水热法分别制备MoO 3和ZrC前驱体，将水热后的两种悬浊液通过液液掺杂的方式进行混和并充分搅拌，经过滤、冷冻干燥得到微米级MoO 3和纳米级ZrC的前驱体，该制备工艺制备的钼合金能够在较低温度下完成烧结得到比较细小的晶粒，放电等离子烧结温度低、时间短，能够减少能源消耗，提高制备的经济性和可持续性，同时，液液掺杂能够使MoO 3和ZrC前驱体均匀分散在水溶液中，实现细晶钼合金中第二相的均匀分布，进而提高材料性能的一致性和稳定性，此外，制备的钼合金具有较小的晶粒尺寸，通常在纳米至微米级别，能够提高材料的整体力学性能。

abstract.text: The present utility model will find application in systems for a sensor-based approach for remote flame propagation, providing encrypted two-way communication and galvanic separation between control and power circuits. The created system for sensor-based remote flame propagation includes a temperature sensor (1), connected to a first single-board computer (2), which via a Wi-Fi module (3) is connected to a proxy server (4). The proxy server (4) via a second Wi-Fi module (6) is connected to a second single-board computer (5), controlling a relay module (7), activating a solenoid valve (8), connected to a high-voltage generator (9), creating an electric spark. The Wi-Fi modules (3 and 6) used for connecting to the global Internet network are Wi-Fi tethering modules.

Настоящият полезен модел ще намери приложение при системи за сензорно-базиран подход за дистанционно разпространение на пламък, осигуряващ криптирана двупосочна комуникация и галванично разделяне между управляващи и силови вериги. Създадената система за сензорно-базирано дистанционно разпространение на пламък, включва температурен сензор (1), свързан към първи едноплатков компютър (2), който чрез Wi-Fi модул (3) е свързан с прокси сървър (4). Прокси сървърът (4) през втори Wi-Fi модул (6) е свързан с втори едноплатков компютър (5), управляващ релеен модул (7), задействащ електромагнитен клапан (8), свързан с високоволтов генератор (9), създаващ електрическа искра. Използваните Wi-Fi модули (3 и 6) за свързване към глобалната интернет мрежа са Wi-Fi тетеринг модули.

abstract.text: A gas-filled spark gap for the protection of an electric installation has an electrically-insulating body, two electrodes fixed to the electrical-insulating body and spaced from one another in a main direction, an inter-electrode space formed in the electrically-insulating body between the two electrodes, two connecting terminals intended to enable electrical connection of the gas-filled spark gap to the electric installation being electrically-connected to a respective one of the two electrodes, an inter-electrode space including a diverter channel defining a propagation trajectory for an electric arc, and a gas trapped in the inter-electrode space, the gas being selected from argon Ar, neon Ne, nitrogen N2, hydrogen H2, helium He and mixtures thereof.

abstract.text: An electrical power line mounted fire warning system and a method of monitoring and providing a fire warning using the same are provided. An electrical power line mounted fire warning system includes: a plurality of sensor nodes, each including a housing mountable on an electrical power line, a plurality of sensors supported by the housing and including an IR sensor and/or a bolometer to detect a fire, and optionally including an electromagnetic sensor to detect at least one of a spark, a current surge of the electrical power line, or a line short of the electrical power line, a microcontroller configured to determine existence of a fire or a fire risk based on one or more parameters detected by the plurality of sensors, and a communication device.

invention_title.text: INDOOR AIR IONIZER

abstract.text: An ionizer comprises a case 4 equipped with air flow inlet 12 having the shape of triangular prism dividing incoming air flow into two flows 1, two ionized air flow emitters 9 and 10, and mesh electrodes are placed in the channels 5 and 6 formed between them, and grounded grid componentry 7 and 8 in conjunction with electrodes to produce ions of uniform concentration, furthermore, mesh electrodes are covered with conductive carbon nanofibers, and power converter is designed to provide different voltage modes on each grid electrode to charge the nanofibers with static electric charge, and produce positive ions on one side and negative ions on another. The device operates in two modes, namely, low voltage, ion generation, spark discharge mode, and high voltage, ozone generation, spark discharge mode. At that, the coating of conductive nanofiber powder on metal mesh is executed with sintering it in inert gas at 1095-1110°C under the pressure of 35-45 atm. Or by spot welding using welding machine or by spraying nanofibers onto thin layer of conductive monomer preapplied to the surface of metal mesh, and by orienting the surface of the fibers in a direction using an electrostatic field and fixing them in this position until polymerization is complete.

abstract.text: The present application relates to a method and apparatus for communication in a wireless local area network, and a readable storage medium. The method comprises: a station receiving a trigger frame, wherein a resource allocation subfield in a user information field of the trigger frame is used for indicating a DRU allocated to the station, and a spatial stream subfield is used for indicating the number M of spatial streams of the station; on the basis of the location of a user information field of the station in a user information list field and the number M of spatial streams, the station determining CSD values of the M spatial streams; and then transmitting a PPDU on the basis of the CSD values of the M spatial streams and the allocated DRU. The present application can reduce the correlation between transmitted signals of different devices and improve the system performance. The present application supports IEEE protocols, such as 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8 protocols, integrated millimeter wave/IMMW protocols, UWB protocols or sensing protocols. The present application further supports spark link/nearlink standard protocols, etc.

La présente demande concerne un procédé et un appareil de communication dans un réseau local sans fil, et un support de stockage lisible. Le procédé comprend les étapes suivantes : une station reçoit une trame de déclenchement, un sous-champ d'attribution de ressources dans un champ d'informations d'utilisateur de la trame de déclenchement étant utilisé pour indiquer une DRU attribuée à la station, et un sous-champ de flux spatial étant utilisé pour indiquer le nombre M de flux spatiaux de la station ; sur la base de l'emplacement d'un champ d'informations d'utilisateur de la station dans un champ de liste d'informations d'utilisateur et du nombre M de flux spatiaux, la station détermine des valeurs CSD des M flux spatiaux ; puis transmet une PPDU sur la base des valeurs CSD des M flux spatiaux et de la DRU attribuée. La présente demande peut réduire la corrélation entre des signaux transmis de différents dispositifs et améliorer les performances du système. La présente demande prend en charge des protocoles IEEE, tels que les protocoles 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8, des protocoles à onde millimétrique intégrée/IMMW, des protocoles UWB ou des protocoles de détection. La présente demande prend en outre en charge des protocoles des normes spark link/nearlink, etc.

本申请涉及一种无线局域网中的通信方法、装置及可读存储介质，该方法包括：站点接收触发帧，该触发帧的用户信息字段中资源分配子字段用于指示为站点分配的DRU，空间流子字段用于指示站点的空间流数M；站点根据自身的用户信息字段在用户信息列表字段中的位置和空间流数M，确定M个空间流的CSD值；再根据该M个空间流的CSD值和被分配的DRU发送PPDU。采用本申请可以降低不同设备的发送信号之间的相关性，提高系统性能。本申请支持IEEE协议，如802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8协议，集成毫米波/IMMW协议，UWB协议，或感知协议等。本申请还支持星闪/spark link/nearlink标准协议等。

abstract.text: A water heater includes a gas burner, a thermoelectric element, a pilot, a main valve, a damper, and a controller that actuates an intermittent spark generator to ignite a pilot flame of the pilot after a first predetermined condition is satisfied, moves the damper toward the open position when the energy generated by the thermoelectric element exceeds a threshold value, and opens the main valve to permit flow of gas to the gas burner after the damper is in the open position and after a second predetermined condition is satisfied. The first predetermined condition is different from the second predetermined condition and the first predetermined condition is selected to be satisfied before the second predetermined condition is satisfied.

abstract.text: A surge protective device includes a first electrical terminal, a second electrical terminal, and an overvoltage protection circuit connected between the first electrical terminal and the second electrical terminal. The overvoltage protection circuit includes a spark gap assembly between the first electrical terminal and the second electrical terminal. The spark gap assembly includes a first spark gap (SG) electrode and a second SG electrode defining a spark gap therebetween, and a trigger circuit operative to ignite a main electric arc between the first and second SG electrodes across the spark gap. The trigger circuit includes a groove defined in the second SG electrode, and a trigger member disposed in the groove. The trigger member is operative to assist formation of a trigger arc.

abstract.text: A spark gap is configured to provide an enhanced spark over voltage. The spark gap includes a non-smooth textured substrate surface, a first conducting electrode, a second conducting electrode, a gap configured to be disposed between the first and second conducting electrodes, and a conductive material configured to be disposed in a non-continuous and irregular manner on the non-smooth textured substrate surface and in the gap between the first and second conducting electrodes, wherein the spark gap is structurally configured to provide an enhanced spark over voltage to protect any device connected to the spark gap.

Una vía de chispas está configurada para proporcionar una sobretensión de chispa mejorada. La vía de chispas incluye una superficie de sustrato de textura no lisa, un primer electrodo conductor, un segundo electrodo conductor, un vía configurada para disponerse entre los electrodos conductores primero y segundo, y un material conductor configurado para disponerse de manera no continua e irregular sobre la superficie de sustrato de textura no lisa y en la vía entre los electrodos conductores primero y segundo, en donde la vía de chispas está configurada estructuralmente para proporcionar una sobretensión de chispa mejorada para proteger cualquier dispositivo conectado a la vía de chispas.

classifications_ipcr.symbol:
B22F   1/    05            A I                    
                            
                            
                                B22F   3/    10            A I

abstract.text: The present disclosure relates to the technical field of powder metallurgy, especially to a coarse grain cemented carbide and a preparation method thereof. Pseudo particles in coarse grain tungsten carbide are removed by pretreating process. Broken of the coarse grain tungsten carbide in traditional wet milling is avoid by solid-liquid stirring, spay granulating and surface covering, which also guarantee the uniform distribution of PEG and cobalt salt. Transformation from cobalt salt to cobalt is safely and effectively guaranteed by performing two sintering stages with different atmosphere and temperature to obtain a WC—Co mixture material. By performing spark plasma sintering process, the precipitation of nano fine grain tungsten carbide guarantees regrowth of defect occurred in pretreating process. The coarse grain cemented carbide with the average grain size of WC above 10 μm, the uniform cobalt phase distribution and he bending strength not less than 2200 MPa is prepared.

invention_title.text: SYSTEMS, DEVICES, AND METHODS FOR SHOCK WAVE GENERATION UTILIZING CATHETERS WITH MULTI-METAL JOINTS

abstract.text: An exemplary catheter includes a catheter body, a first conductive member comprising a first material positioned on the catheter body, a second conductive member comprising a second material different from the first material positioned on the catheter body, one or more electrical joints configured to electrically couple the first conductive member to the second conductive member, and one or more shock wave emitters. Each shock wave emitter is configured to generate a shock wave, and at least one shock wave emitter of the one or more shock wave emitters comprises electrodes separated by a spark gap, wherein at least one of the electrodes is formed from the second conductive member.

invention_title.text: SYSTÈMES, DISPOSITIFS ET PROCÉDÉS DE GÉNÉRATION D'ONDES DE CHOC UTILISANT DES CATHÉTERS À ARTICULATIONS MULTI-MÉTALLIQUES

Each shock wave emitter is configured to generate a shock wave, and at least one shock wave emitter of the one or more shock wave emitters comprises electrodes separated by a spark gap, wherein at least one of the electrodes is formed from the second conductive member.

Un cathéter donné à titre d'exemple comprend un corps de cathéter, un premier élément conducteur comprenant un premier matériau positionné sur le corps de cathéter, un second élément conducteur comprenant un second matériau différent du premier matériau positionné sur le corps de cathéter, une ou plusieurs articulations électriques configurées pour coupler électriquement le premier élément conducteur au second élément conducteur, et un ou plusieurs émetteurs d'ondes de choc. Chaque émetteur d'ondes de choc est configuré pour générer une onde de choc, et au moins un émetteur d'ondes de choc du ou des émetteurs d'ondes de choc comprend des électrodes séparées par un éclateur, au moins l'une des électrodes étant formée à partir du second élément conducteur.

abstract.text: A coordinated spatial reuse (co-SR) method and apparatus, applicable to the technical field of communications. The present application supports IEEE protocols, such as the IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT protocol, the IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8 protocol, the integrated millimeter wave (IMMW) protocol, the IEEE 802.15/UWB protocol, or the IEEE 802.11bf/sensing protocol, or the spark link protocol. A first station acquires a TXOP and then transmits a first control frame, so that a second station can know that the second station is allowed to contend for a channel within the TXOP acquired by the first station. Therefore, the first station can interact with other stations in this BSS, and once the channel has been successfully obtained, the second station also can interact with other stations in the BSS, thereby effectively realizing the purpose of co-SR, and improving the flexibility of co-SR.

Procédé et appareil de réutilisation spatiale coordonnée (co-SR), applicables au domaine technique des communications. La présente demande prend en charge des protocoles IEEE, tels que le protocole IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT, le protocole IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8, le protocole d'onde millimétrique intégrée (IMMW), le protocole IEEE 802,15/UWB, ou le protocole IEEE 802.11bf/détection, ou le protocole de liaison Spark. Une première station acquiert une TXOP et transmet ensuite une première trame de commande, de telle sorte qu'une seconde station peut savoir que la seconde station est autorisée à entrer en concurrence pour un canal à l'intérieur de la TXOP acquise par la première station. Par conséquent, la première station peut interagir avec d'autres stations dans ce BSS, et une fois que le canal a été obtenu avec succès, la seconde station peut également interagir avec d'autres stations dans le BSS, ce qui permet de réaliser efficacement l'objectif de co-SR, et d'améliorer la flexibilité de la co-SR.

一种协作空间复用方法及装置，可以应用于通信技术领域。本申请支持IEEE协议如IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT协议，IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8协议，集成毫米波/IMMW协议，IEEE 802.15/UWB协议，或IEEE 802.11bf/sensing/感知协议，或者星闪协议等。第一站点在获得TXOP之后，通过发送第一控制帧，可使得第二站点能够获知其允许在第一站点获得的TXOP内竞争信道。从而第一站点可以与本BSS内的其他站点交互，第二站点在成功竞争到信道之后也可以与其BSS内的站点交互，有效实现了协作空间复用的目的，提高了co-SR的灵活性。

invention_title.text: CATHÉTER D'ABLATION PAR CHAMP ÉLECTRIQUE PULSÉ ET PROCÉDÉ DE REFROIDISSEMENT
PULSED ELECTRIC FIELD ABLATION CATHETER AND COOLING METHOD
脉冲电场消融导管及降温方法

extracted_name.value: SHENZHEN PULSECARE MEDICAL TECH CO LTD [CN]
深圳迈微医疗科技有限公司

abstract.text: The present application is applicable to the technical field of pulsed electric field ablation catheters, and provides a pulsed electric field ablation catheter. The pulsed electric field ablation catheter comprises: a tube body part and an expansion part. The tube body part comprises a main body tube and a push-pull tube, and the push-pull tube movably penetrates through the main body tube and at least partially extends out from a distal end of the main body tube. The expansion part comprises an expansion tube, and a plurality of branch tubes are formed between a proximal end and a distal end of the expansion tube. At least one treatment electrode is provided on the branch tube, and a cooling gap in communication with the external environment is provided between the branch tube and the treatment electrode. A first perfusion channel is provided on the main body tube, and a second perfusion channel is provided on the branch tube. The first perfusion channel is in communication with the second perfusion channel, and the second perfusion channel is in communication with the cooling gap. The pulsed electric field ablation catheter provided by the present application does not require a perfusion hole to be formed on the surface of the treatment electrode, which can effectively avoid the phenomenon of spark discharge on the treatment electrode, offering high reliability.

La présente demande est applicable au domaine technique des cathéters d'ablation par champ électrique pulsé, et concerne un cathéter d'ablation par champ électrique pulsé. Le cathéter d'ablation par champ électrique pulsé comprend : une partie corps de tube et une partie d'expansion. La partie corps de tube comporte un tube de corps principal et un tube de poussée-traction, et le tube de poussée-traction pénètre de façon mobile à travers le tube de corps principal et s'étend au moins partiellement hors d'une extrémité distale du tube de corps principal. La partie d'expansion comporte un tube d'expansion, et une pluralité de tubes de dérivation sont formés entre une extrémité proximale et une extrémité distale du tube d'expansion. Au moins une électrode de traitement est disposée sur le tube de dérivation, et un espace de refroidissement en communication avec l'environnement externe est disposé entre le tube de dérivation et l'électrode de traitement. Un premier canal de perfusion est disposé sur le tube de corps principal, et un second canal de perfusion est disposé sur le tube de dérivation. Le premier canal de perfusion est en communication avec le second canal de perfusion, et le second canal de perfusion est en communication avec l'espace de refroidissement. Le cathéter d'ablation par champ électrique pulsé selon la présente demande ne nécessite pas la formation d'un trou de perfusion sur la surface de l'électrode de traitement, ce qui peut éviter efficacement le phénomène de décharge d'étincelle sur l'électrode de traitement, offrant une fiabilité élevée.

本申请适用于脉冲电场消融导管技术领域，提供了一种脉冲电场消融导管，脉冲电场消融导管包括：管体部及膨胀部，其中管体部包括主体管及推拉管，推拉管可移动的穿设在主体管内，并至少部分从主体管的远端伸出；膨胀部包括膨胀管，膨胀管的近端和远端之间形成有多个分支管；分支管上设置有至少一个治疗电极，分支管与治疗电极之间具有与外部环境连通的冷却间隙，主体管上设置有第一灌注通道，分支管上设置有第二灌注通道，第一灌注通道与第二灌注通道连通，第二灌注通道与冷却间隙连通。本申请所提供的脉冲电场消融导管无需在治疗电极的表面开设灌注孔，能够有效的避免治疗电极上出现火花放电的现象，可靠性较高。
