abstract.text: The medicine bag drying, sterilizing and heating cabinet comprises a water storage tank and a heating part, and the water storage tank is provided with a steam channel and a water return channel; a plurality of disinfection boxes are sequentially arranged above the water storage tank, and each disinfection box is provided with an air inlet channel and an air outlet channel; a water-vapor separation part and a condensation box are arranged between the water storage tank and the disinfection box; the water-steam separation part is communicated between the steam channel and the air inlet channel; the water-vapor separation part is provided with a drainage channel which is communicated with the water return channel; the condensing box communicates with the air outlet channel and the water return channel; the condensation boxes are arranged on one sides of the corresponding disinfection boxes and are sequentially stacked above the water storage box, and the upper condensation box is communicated with the lower condensation box through a drainage pipe. The water storage tank is heated through the heating part to produce high-temperature and high-humidity steam, water in the steam is separated through the water-steam separation part, the high-temperature and low-humidity steam is obtained to dry and heat a medicine bag, the water is recycled to the water storage tank through the condensation box, and the medicine bag drying and heating device has the advantages of being small in consumption and high in safety.

本发明公开了一种药包干燥除菌加热柜，包括储水箱和加热部，储水箱配置蒸气通道和回水通道；储水箱的上方依次设置多个消毒箱，消毒箱配置有进气通道和出气通道；储水箱与消毒箱之间设置有水汽分离部和冷凝箱；水汽分离部连通于蒸气通道与进气通道之间；水汽分离部配置有排水通道，排水通道与回水通道连通；冷凝箱连通于出气通道与回水通道；冷凝箱设置于对应的消毒箱的一侧，依次叠设于储水箱的上方，且上方的冷凝箱通过一排水管与下方的冷凝箱连通。通过加热部对储水箱加热生产高温高湿的蒸气，并利用水汽分离部分离其中的水分，得到高温低湿的蒸气对药包进行干燥加热，并利用冷凝箱回收水分至储水箱，具备消耗小且安全性高的优点。

invention_title.text: Frying and baking machine
煎烤机

extracted_name.value: ZHEJIANG SUPOR ELECTRICAL APPLIANCES MFG CO LTD
浙江苏泊尔家电制造有限公司

abstract.text: The utility model relates to a frying and baking machine which comprises a base assembly, an upper cover assembly and a water tank assembly, the upper cover assembly can cover the base assembly, the base assembly comprises a lower baking tray, the lower baking tray is provided with a cooking groove and a water groove, the water tank assembly is installed on the base assembly or the upper cover assembly, the water tank assembly comprises a box body and a pipeline, and the box body can be communicated with the water groove through the pipeline. A switch valve is arranged on the pipeline, the switch valve comprises a valve body and a valve element rotatably arranged in the valve body, and the switch valve controls the pipeline to be opened and closed through rotation of the valve element. According to the frying and baking machine, the water tank does not need to be filled with water before cooking, only the water needs to be added into the box body, only the valve element needs to be rotated to control opening and closing of the switch valve in the cooking process, then the box body can be controlled to add the water into the water tank or stop adding the water, steam can be rapidly generated, and the upper cover assembly does not need to be opened; therefore, the problem that the cooking effect is affected due to steam escape and rapid temperature reduction caused by uncovering and water adding is avoided.

本申请涉及一种煎烤机，包括底座组件、上盖组件以及水箱组件，上盖组件可盖合于底座组件，底座组件包括下烤盘，下烤盘设有烹饪槽和水槽，水箱组件安装于底座组件或上盖组件，水箱组件包括箱体以及管道，箱体能够通过管道与水槽连通，管道上设有开关阀，开关阀包括阀体和可转动地设于阀体内的阀芯，开关阀通过阀芯的转动控制管道的通断。本申请提供的煎烤机，不需要在烹饪前将水槽加满水，只需将水加到箱体中，在烹饪过程中只需转动阀芯控制开关阀的启闭即可控制箱体往水槽加水或停止加水，可以快速产生蒸汽，且无需将上盖组件打开，从而避免了开盖加水导致的蒸汽逸出及温度快速降低而影响烹饪效果的问题。

invention_title.text: APPAREIL DE FABRICATION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
APPARATUS FOR MANUFACTURING LITHIUM SULFIDE
황화리튬 제조 장치

abstract.text: The present invention relates to an apparatus for manufacturing lithium sulfide. By using the apparatus according to the present invention, when manufacturing lithium sulfide by a reaction between a lithium raw material and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction is performed under relatively mild conditions as compared to the prior art, such that frequent repair or replacement due to corrosion and failure of a reactor and various piping is not required, thereby improving the economic efficiency of the process. In addition, unreacted hydrogen sulfide and a solvent, from which moisture has been removed, are reused, thereby reducing process costs and securing economic feasibility during mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed, thereby preventing a reverse reaction to lithium hydroxide and promoting a forward reaction, thus enabling high-quality lithium sulfide to be produced with high purity and high yield. In addition, particle size can be adjusted in units of ㎛ without a separate pulverization space or a separate pulverization step, thus providing excellent convenience and mass productivity.

La présente invention concerne un appareil de fabrication de sulfure de lithium. En utilisant l'appareil selon la présente invention, lors de la fabrication de sulfure de lithium par une réaction entre une matière première de lithium et du sulfure d'hydrogène, la réaction est effectuée dans des conditions relativement modérées par rapport à l'état de la technique, de telle sorte qu'une réparation ou un remplacement fréquent en raison de la corrosion et de la défaillance d'un réacteur et de diverses conduites n'est pas nécessaire, ce qui permet d'améliorer l'efficacité économique du procédé. De plus, le sulfure d'hydrogène n'ayant pas réagi et un solvant, à partir duquel l'humidité a été éliminée, sont réutilisés, ce qui permet de réduire les coûts de traitement et de sécuriser la faisabilité économique pendant la production en masse. En outre, l'humidité et la vapeur d'eau générées par la réaction de production de sulfure de lithium sont efficacement éliminées, ce qui permet d'empêcher une réaction inverse à l'hydroxyde de lithium et de favoriser une réaction directe, ce qui permet de produire du sulfure de lithium de haute qualité avec une pureté élevée et un rendement élevé. De plus, la taille des particules peut être ajustée en unités de µm sans espace de pulvérisation séparé ou étape de pulvérisation séparée, ce qui permet d'obtenir une excellente commodité et une excellente productivité en masse.

본 발명은 황화리튬 제조 장치에 관한 것으로, 본 발명에 따른 장치를 활용하면, 리튬 원료와 황화수소 간 반응으로 황화리튬을 제조할 때, 종래 기술 대비 상대적으로 온화한 조건 하에서 반응이 수행되므로 반응기 및 각종 파이핑(piping)의 부식과 고장에 따른 잦은 수리 내지 교체가 요구되지 아니하여 공정의 경제성이 향상된다. 또한, 수분이 제거된 미반응 황화수소와 용매가 재사용됨으로써, 공정 비용이 절감되어 대량 생산 시 경제성을 확보할 수 있다. 나아가 황화리튬 생성 반응으로 발생한 수분과 수증기가 효과적으로 제거되어, 수산화리튬으로의 역반응을 방지하고, 정반응을 촉진하여 고순도, 고수율로 고품질의 황화리튬을 제조할 수 있다. 또한, 별도의 분쇄 공간 내지 분쇄 단계 없이 ㎛ 단위로 입자 사이즈 조절이 가능하여 편의성과 양산성이 우수하다.

invention_title.text: PROCÉDÉ DE PRÉPARATION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
METHOD FOR PREPARING LITHIUM SULFIDE
황화리튬 제조방법

abstract.text: The present invention relates to a method for preparing lithium sulfide. According to the present invention, when lithium sulfide is prepared by a reaction between a lithium raw material and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction proceeds under relatively mild conditions compared with conventional technologies. Thus, repair or replacement due to corrosion and failure of reactors and various piping components is not frequently required, thereby improving the economic feasibility of the process. In addition, the unreacted hydrogen sulfide and solvent from which moisture has been removed can be reused, thereby reducing process costs and securing economic feasibility in mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed, thereby preventing the reverse reaction to lithium hydroxide and promoting the forward reaction to prepare high-quality lithium sulfide with high purity and high yield.

La présente invention concerne un procédé de préparation de sulfure de lithium. Selon la présente invention, lorsque du sulfure de lithium est préparé par une réaction entre une matière première de lithium et du sulfure d'hydrogène, la réaction se déroule dans des conditions relativement modérées par rapport aux technologies classiques. Ainsi, la réparation ou le remplacement dû à la corrosion et à la défaillance de réacteurs et de divers composants de tuyauterie n'est pas fréquemment nécessaire, ce qui permet d'améliorer la faisabilité économique du procédé. De plus, le sulfure d'hydrogène n'ayant pas réagi et le solvant dont l'humidité a été éliminée peuvent être réutilisés, ce qui permet de réduire les coûts de traitement et de garantir une faisabilité économique dans la production en masse. En outre, l'humidité et la vapeur d'eau générées par la réaction de production de sulfure de lithium sont efficacement éliminées, ce qui permet d'empêcher la réaction inverse à l'hydroxyde de lithium et de favoriser la réaction directe pour préparer du sulfure de lithium de haute qualité avec une pureté élevée et un rendement élevé.

본 발명은 황화리튬 제조방법에 관한 것으로, 본 발명에 따르면, 리튬 원료와 황화수소 간 반응으로 황화리튬을 제조할 때, 종래 기술 대비 상대적으로 온화한 조건 하에서 반응이 수행되므로 반응기 및 각종 파이핑(piping)의 부식과 고장에 따른 잦은 수리 내지 교체가 요구되지 아니하여 공정의 경제성이 향상된다. 또한, 수분이 제거된 미반응 황화수소와 용매가 재사용됨으로써, 공정 비용이 절감되어 대량 생산 시 경제성을 확보할 수 있다. 나아가 황화리튬 생성 반응으로 발생한 수분과 수증기가 효과적으로 제거되어, 수산화리튬으로의 역반응을 방지하고, 정반응을 촉진하여 고순도, 고수율로 고품질의 황화리튬을 제조할 수 있다.

invention_title.text: PROCÉDÉ DE PRODUCTION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
METHOD FOR PRODUCING LITHIUM SULFIDE
황화리튬 제조방법

abstract.text: The present invention relates to a method for producing lithium sulfide. According to the present invention, when producing lithium sulfide by a reaction between a lithium source and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction is performed under relatively mild conditions compared to the prior art, and thus the economic efficiency of the process is improved since frequent repairs or replacements necessitated by corrosion and failure of a reactor and various piping are not required. In addition, since dehydrated, unreacted hydrogen sulfide and solvents are recycled, the process cost is reduced, and thus economic efficiency can be achieved in mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed to prevent a reverse reaction to lithium hydroxide and promote a forward reaction, thereby enabling the production of high-quality lithium sulfide with high purity and high yield. In addition, particle size can be adjusted at a µm level without a separate pulverization space or pulverization step, and thus excellent convenience and mass productivity are achieved.

La présente invention concerne un procédé de production de sulfure de lithium. Selon la présente invention, lors de la production de sulfure de lithium par réaction entre une source de lithium et du sulfure d'hydrogène, la réaction est effectuée dans des conditions relativement modérées par rapport à l'état de la technique, ce qui améliore l'efficience économique du procédé, car il n'est pas nécessaire de procéder à des réparations ou des remplacements fréquents résultant de la corrosion et la défaillance d'un réacteur et de diverses conduites. De plus, comme le sulfure d'hydrogène et les solvants déshydratés n'ayant pas réagi sont recyclés, le coût du procédé est réduit, ce qui permet d'atteindre une bonne efficience économique dans la production de masse. En outre, l'humidité et la vapeur d'eau générées par la réaction de production de sulfure de lithium sont efficacement éliminées afin d'empêcher une réaction inverse vers l'hydroxyde de lithium et de favoriser une réaction directe, permettant ainsi la production d'un sulfure de lithium de haute qualité, d'une grande pureté et d'un rendement élevé. De plus, la granulométrie peut être ajustée à l'échelle du µm sans espace ni étape de pulvérisation séparés, ce qui garantit d'excellents avantages et une bonne productivité de masse.

본 발명은 황화리튬 제조방법에 관한 것으로, 본 발명에 따르면, 리튬 원료와 황화수소 간 반응으로 황화리튬을 제조할 때, 종래 기술 대비 상대적으로 온화한 조건 하에서 반응이 수행되므로 반응기 및 각종 파이핑(piping)의 부식과 고장에 따른 잦은 수리 내지 교체가 요구되지 아니하여 공정의 경제성이 향상된다. 또한, 수분이 제거된 미반응 황화수소와 용매가 재사용됨으로써, 공정 비용이 절감되어 대량 생산 시 경제성을 확보할 수 있다. 나아가 황화리튬 생성 반응으로 발생한 수분과 수증기가 효과적으로 제거되어, 수산화리튬으로의 역반응을 방지하고, 정반응을 촉진하여 고순도, 고수율로 고품질의 황화리튬을 제조할 수 있다. 또한, 별도의 분쇄 공간 내지 분쇄 단계 없이 ㎛ 단위로 입자 사이즈 조절이 가능하여 편의성과 양산성이 우수하다.

invention_title.text: PROCÉDÉ DE PRÉPARATION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
METHOD FOR PREPARING LITHIUM SULFIDE
황화리튬 제조방법

abstract.text: The present invention relates to a method for preparing lithium sulfide. According to the present invention, when preparing lithium sulfide by a reaction between a lithium raw material and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction is carried out under relatively mild conditions as compared to the prior art, and thus frequent repair or replacement due to corrosion and failure of a reactor and various piping is not required, thereby improving the economic feasibility of the process. In addition, by reusing unreacted hydrogen sulfide from which moisture has been removed and a solvent, process costs are reduced, thereby ensuring economic feasibility during mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed, thus preventing a reverse reaction back to lithium hydroxide and promoting a forward reaction, thus enabling the production of high-quality lithium sulfide with high purity and high yield. In addition, particle size adjustment can be achieved in units of μm without a separate pulverization space or pulverization step, thereby providing excellent convenience and mass production.

La présente invention concerne un procédé de préparation de sulfure de lithium. Selon la présente invention, lors de la préparation de sulfure de lithium par une réaction entre une matière première de lithium et du sulfure d'hydrogène, la réaction est effectuée dans des conditions relativement modérées par rapport à l'état de la technique, et ainsi une réparation ou un remplacement fréquent en raison de la corrosion et de la défaillance d'un réacteur et de diverses conduites n'est pas nécessaire, ce qui permet d'améliorer la faisabilité économique du processus. De plus, en réutilisant le sulfure d'hydrogène n'ayant pas réagi, dont l'humidité a été éliminée, et un solvant, les coûts de traitement sont réduits, ce qui permet d'assurer la faisabilité économique pour la production de masse. En outre, l'humidité et la vapeur d'eau générées par la réaction de production de sulfure de lithium sont efficacement éliminées, empêchant ainsi une réaction inverse vers l'hydroxyde de lithium et favorisant une réaction directe, permettant ainsi la production de sulfure de lithium de haute qualité avec une pureté élevée et un rendement élevé. De plus, un ajustement de taille de particule peut être obtenu en unités de µm sans espace de pulvérisation ni étape de pulvérisation séparés, ce qui favorise la production de masse et la praticité.

본 발명은 황화리튬 제조방법에 관한 것으로, 본 발명에 따르면, 리튬 원료와 황화수소 간 반응으로 황화리튬을 제조할 때, 종래 기술 대비 상대적으로 온화한 조건 하에서 반응이 수행되므로 반응기 및 각종 파이핑(piping)의 부식과 고장에 따른 잦은 수리 내지 교체가 요구되지 아니하여 공정의 경제성이 향상된다. 또한, 수분이 제거된 미반응 황화수소와 용매가 재사용됨으로써, 공정 비용이 절감되어 대량 생산 시 경제성을 확보할 수 있다. 나아가 황화리튬 생성 반응으로 발생한 수분과 수증기가 효과적으로 제거되어, 수산화리튬으로의 역반응을 방지하고, 정반응을 촉진하여 고순도, 고수율로 고품질의 황화리튬을 제조할 수 있다. 또한, 별도의 분쇄 공간 내지 분쇄 단계 없이 ㎛ 단위로 입자 사이즈 조절이 가능하여 편의성과 양산성이 우수하다.

According to the present invention, when producing lithium sulfide by a reaction between a lithium source and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction is performed under relatively mild conditions compared to the prior art, and thus the economic efficiency of the process is improved since frequent repairs or replacements necessitated by corrosion and failure of a reactor and various piping are not required. In addition, since dehydrated, unreacted hydrogen sulfide and solvents are recycled, the process cost is reduced, and thus economic efficiency can be achieved in mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed to prevent a reverse reaction to lithium hydroxide and promote a forward reaction, thereby enabling the production of high-quality lithium sulfide with high purity and high yield.

La présente invention concerne un procédé de production de sulfure de lithium. Selon la présente invention, lors de la production de sulfure de lithium par une réaction entre une source de lithium et du sulfure d'hydrogène, la réaction est effectuée dans des conditions relativement douces par rapport à l'état de la technique, et ainsi l'efficacité économique du procédé est améliorée étant donné que des réparations ou des remplacements fréquents à cause de la corrosion et des défaillances d'un réacteur et de diverses conduites ne sont pas nécessaires. En outre, étant donné que le sulfure d'hydrogène et les solvants déshydratés n'ayant pas réagi sont recyclés, le coût du procédé est réduit, ce qui permet d'obtenir une efficacité économique lors d'une production en masse. En outre, l'humidité et la vapeur d'eau générées par la réaction de production de sulfure de lithium sont éliminées de manière efficace pour empêcher une réaction inverse vers l'hydroxyde de lithium et favoriser une réaction directe, ce qui permet la production d'un sulfure de lithium de haute qualité présentant une pureté élevée et avec un rendement élevé.

invention_title.text: SYSTÈME DE PRODUCTION D'HYDROGÈNE
HYDROGEN PRODUCTION SYSTEM
水素製造システム

abstract.text: Provided is a hydrogen production system (40) which comprises: an exhaust heat reception unit (41) that receives exhaust heat generated by an external exhaust heat source (11); a water vapor generation unit (42) that generates water vapor by heating water by means of the exhaust heat received by the exhaust heat reception unit (41); a cell stack (43) that electrolyzes the water vapor generated by the water vapor generation unit (42) so as to generate hydrogen; and a replenishment unit (44) that, when the amount of exhaust heat is insufficient with respect to the amount necessary for generating the required amount of water vapor, replenishes water, water vapor, or the water vapor generation unit (42) with heat, or replenishes the cell stack (43) with water vapor from an external water vapor supply source (95).

L'invention concerne un système de production d'hydrogène (40) qui comprend : une unité de réception de chaleur d'échappement (41) qui reçoit la chaleur d'échappement générée par une source de chaleur d'échappement externe (11) ; une unité de génération de vapeur d'eau (42) qui génère de la vapeur d'eau en chauffant de l'eau au moyen de la chaleur d'échappement reçue par l'unité de réception de chaleur d'échappement (41) ; un empilement de cellules (43) qui électrolyse la vapeur d'eau générée par l'unité de génération de vapeur d'eau (42) de façon à générer de l'hydrogène ; et une unité de réapprovisionnement (44) qui, lorsque la quantité de chaleur d'échappement est insuffisante par rapport à la quantité nécessaire pour générer la quantité requise de vapeur d'eau, réapprovisionne de l'eau, de la vapeur d'eau ou l'unité de génération de vapeur d'eau (42) en chaleur, ou réapprovisionne l'empilement de cellules (43) en vapeur d'eau provenant d'une source d'alimentation en vapeur d'eau externe (95).

外部排熱源（１１）から発生した排熱を受取る排熱受取り部（４１）と、排熱受取り部（４１）が受取った排熱によって水を加熱することにより水蒸気を生成する水蒸気生成部（４２）と、水蒸気生成部（４２）が生成した水蒸気を電気分解して水素を生成するセルスタック（４３）と、排熱の量が、要求される量の水蒸気を生成するために必要な量に対して不足した場合に、水、水蒸気、若しくは水蒸気生成部（４２）に熱を補充するか、または、外部の水蒸気供給源（９５）からセルスタック（４３）に水蒸気を補充する補充部（４４）と、を備える水素製造システム（４０）。

invention_title.text: APPAREIL DE PRODUCTION DE BIOCHARBON POREUX À HAUTE PERFORMANCE
APPARATUS FOR MANUFACTURING HIGH-PERFORMANCE POROUS BIOCHAR
다공성 고기능 바이오차 제조장치

abstract.text: Disclosed is an apparatus for manufacturing a high-performance porous biochar, capable of preventing water vapor and gas in a carbonization facility from leaking to the outside, and preventing a coking phenomenon in which livestock manure remaining in a carbonization furnace adheres to the inner circumferential surface of the carbonization furnace. The apparatus for manufacturing a high-performance porous biochar comprises: a livestock manure supply facility for supplying and transferring a large amount of livestock manure containing moisture; and a carbonization facility for, when the livestock manure is input from the livestock manure supply facility, creating an oxygen-blocked atmosphere within the carbonization facility and heating the carbonization facility to a predetermined temperature to carbonize the livestock manure, wherein the livestock manure supply facility is configured to automatically open and close an outlet according to whether the livestock manure is discharged, and seal a connection portion between the livestock manure supply facility and the carbonization facility.

L'invention concerne un appareil de production d'un biocharbon poreux à haute performance, apte à empêcher la fuite vers l'extérieur de la vapeur d'eau et du gaz dans une installation de carbonisation, et à empêcher un phénomène de cokéfaction par lequel le fumier restant dans un four de carbonisation adhère à la surface circonférentielle interne du four de carbonisation. L'appareil de fabrication d'un biocharbon poreux à haute performance comprend : une installation d'alimentation en fumier destinée à fournir et transférer une grande quantité de fumier contenant de l'humidité ; et une installation de carbonisation destinée à, lorsque le fumier est introduit à partir de l'installation d'alimentation en fumier, créer une atmosphère appauvrie en oxygène à l'intérieur de l'installation de carbonisation et chauffer l'installation de carbonisation à une température prédéterminée afin de carboniser le fumier, l'installation d'alimentation en fumier étant conçue pour ouvrir et fermer automatiquement une sortie selon que le fumier est évacué ou non, et sceller une partie de raccordement entre l'installation d'alimentation en fumier et l'installation de carbonisation.

탄화 설비 내의 수증기 및 가스가 외부로 누출되는 것을 방지하고, 탄화로 내에 잔류된 축분이 탄화로의 내주면에 부착되는 코킹현상을 방지할 수 있는 다공성 고기능 바이오차 제조장치를 개시한다. 다공성 고기능 바이오차 제조장치는 수분을 포함하는 대량의 축분을 공급 및 이송하는 축분 공급 설비 및 축분 공급 설비로부터 축분이 투입되면 내부를 산소가 차단된 분위기로 조성한 후 일정온도로 가열하여 축분을 탄화시키는 탄화 설비를 포함하고, 축분 공급 설비는 축분의 배출 여부에 따라 자동으로 출구를 개폐하고, 축분 공급 설비와 탄화 설비의 연결부위를 기밀하도록 구성된다.

invention_title.text: SPECTROSCOPIE DE POLARISATION À EFFET STARK ET PROCÉDÉS
STARK EFFECT POLARIZATION SPECTROSCOPY AND METHODS

abstract.text: A method of and system for monitoring the level of hydrogen peroxide gas in a system such as an isolation barrier. Gas is sampled from the system to a gas cell. The sampled gas may include hydrogen peroxide gas and water vapor. A laser beam from a laser source at a known polarization state is passed through the gas cell and the hydrogen peroxide gas and water vapor therein. An electrical field is created in the gas cell to reduce optical interference from water vapor while preserving the ability to more accurately measure the concentration of hydrogen peroxide gas in the gas cell. A change in the polarization state of the laser beam after passage through the gas cell is detected. Based on the detected change in the polarization state of the laser beam, the concentration of the hydrogen peroxide gas in the gas cell is determined.

L'invention concerne un procédé et un système de surveillance du niveau de peroxyde d'hydrogène gazeux dans un système tel qu'une barrière d'isolation. Le gaz est fourni en échantillon du système à une cellule à gaz. L'échantillon de gaz peut comprendre du peroxyde d'hydrogène gazeux et de la vapeur d'eau. Un faisceau laser provenant d'une source laser à un état de polarisation connu est amené à passer à travers la cellule à gaz et le peroxyde d'hydrogène gazeux et la vapeur d'eau à l'intérieur de celle-ci. Un champ électrique est créé dans la cellule à gaz pour réduire l'interférence optique provenant de la vapeur d'eau tout en préservant la capacité de mesurer plus précisément la concentration en peroxyde d'hydrogène gazeux dans la cellule à gaz. Un changement dans l'état de polarisation du faisceau laser après le passage à travers la cellule à gaz est détecté. Sur la base du changement détecté dans l'état de polarisation du faisceau laser, la concentration en peroxyde d'hydrogène gazeux dans la cellule à gaz est déterminée.

invention_title.text: PROCÉDÉ ET SYSTÈME DE PRODUCTION DE VAPEUR D'EAU SURCHAUFFÉE À PARTIR DE PEROXYDE D'HYDROGÈNE DE FAIBLE CONCENTRATION
METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR THE PRODUCTION OF SUPERHEATED WATER VAPOR FROM LOW CONCENTRATION HYDROGEN PEROXIDE
MÉTODO Y SISTEMA DE PRODUCCIÓN DE VAPOR DE AGUA SOBRECALENTADO A PARTIR DE PERÓXIDO DE HIDRÓGENO DE BAJA CONCENTRACIÓN

abstract.text: The present invention relates to improvements provided by a system and process for releasing energy and performing work with said energy release applicable in a reaction product capture arrangement; more specifically, within the field of chemical energy release in an afterburner and high-flow steam arrangement utilizing at least one reconcentrated fluid to increase efficiency in harnessing the released energy.

La présente invention concerne les améliorations apportées par un système et un procédé pour libérer de l'énergie et effectuer un travail avec une autre libération d'énergie applicable dans un système de capture de produits de réaction; plus particulièrement, dans le domaine de la libération d'énergie chimique dans un système de postcombustion et vapeur à flux élevé à l'aide d'au moins un fluide reconcentré pour augmenter l'efficacité en termes d'exploitation de l'énergie libérée.

La presente invención se refiere a las mejoras provistas por un sistema y proceso para liberar energía y realizar trabajo con dicha liberación de energía aplicable en un arreglo de captación de productos de reacción; más específicamente, dentro del campo de liberación de energía química en un arreglo de postcombustión y vapor de alto flujo utilizando al menos un fluido reconcentrado para incrementar la eficiencia en el aprovechamiento de la energía liberada.

invention_title.text: STRUCTURE ORGANOMÉTALLIQUE
METAL ORGANIC FRAMEWORK
金属有機構造体

extracted_name.value: NATIONAL UNIV CORPORATION TOKAI NATIONAL HIGHER EDUCATION AND RESEARCH SYSTEM [JP]
日本特殊陶業株式会社,
国立大学法人東海国立大学機構

abstract.text: This metal organic framework comprises a first ligand that has a benzene ring and has two or more functional groups for coordination, and a second ligand that does not contain a benzene ring and contains one functional group for coordination. The ratio of the water vapor adsorption level per unit mass of the metal organic framework at a relative pressure of 0.95 to the water vapor adsorption level per unit mass of a basic structure MOF at a relative pressure of 0.95 is 84% or greater in a water vapor isotherm measured at 298K when a metal organic framework having only the first ligand as a ligand is identified as the basic structure MOF on the basis of the results of powder XRD analysis of the metal organic framework.

La présente invention concerne une structure organométallique comprenant un premier ligand qui a un cycle benzène et a deux groupes fonctionnels ou plus pour la coordination, et un second ligand qui ne contient pas de cycle benzène et contient un groupe fonctionnel pour la coordination. Le rapport du niveau d'adsorption de vapeur d'eau par unité de masse de la structure organométallique à une pression relative de 0,95 au niveau d'adsorption de vapeur d'eau par unité de masse d'une structure de base MOF à une pression relative de 0,95 est de 84% ou plus dans une isotherme de vapeur d'eau mesurée à 298K lorsqu'une structure organométallique ayant uniquement le premier ligand en tant que ligand est identifiée comme structure de base MOF sur la base des résultats de l'analyse XRD sur poudre de la structure organométallique.

金属有機構造体は、ベンゼン環を有すると共に、配位のための官能基を２つ以上有する第１の配位子と、ベンゼン環を含まず、配位のための官能基を１つ含む第２の配位子と、を備える。金属有機構造体を粉末ＸＲＤ分析した結果に基づいて、配位子として、第１の配位子のみを有する金属有機構造体を基本構造ＭＯＦとして特定したときに、２９８Ｋで測定した水蒸気吸着等温線において、基本構造ＭＯＦについての相対圧力が０．９５のときの単位質量当たりの水蒸気吸着量に対する、金属有機構造体についての相対圧力が０．９５のときの単位質量当たりの水蒸気吸着量の比率が、８４％以上である。

invention_title.text: POUDRE À STRUCTURE ORGANOMÉTALLIQUE
METAL ORGANIC FRAMEWORK POWDER
金属有機構造体粉末

extracted_name.value: NATIONAL UNIV CORPORATION TOKAI NATIONAL HIGHER EDUCATION AND RESEARCH SYSTEM [JP]
日本特殊陶業株式会社,
国立大学法人東海国立大学機構

abstract.text: When a basic structure MOF that has only a ligand having two or more functional groups for coordination is specified as a ligand on the basis of the result of powder XRD analysis of this metal organic framework powder, the basic structure MOF has an octahedral particle shape. In an SEM image including 10 or more primary particles which have a particle diameter of 0.1 µm or more and in which at least one or more whole particle surfaces can be observed, if a ridge line having a length of 20 nm or less in a primary particle is assumed to be a point, the ratio of the number of primary particles in which all observed surfaces are triangular to the total number of primary particles observed is less than 40%. In the water vapor adsorption isotherm at 298 K, the ratio of the water vapor adsorption amount per unit volume of the metal organic framework powder to the water vapor adsorption amount per unit volume of the basic structure MOF when the relative pressure is 0.95 is 84% or more.

Lorsqu'une structure de base MOF qui n'a qu'un ligand ayant deux groupes fonctionnels ou plus pour une coordination est spécifiée en tant que ligand sur la base du résultat de l'analyse XRD de poudre de cette poudre de structure organométallique, la structure de base MOF a une forme de particule octaédrique. Dans une image MEB comprenant 10 particules primaires ou plus qui ont un diamètre de particule de 0,1 µm ou plus et dans lesquelles au moins une ou plusieurs surfaces de particule entières peuvent être observées, si une ligne de crête ayant une longueur de 20 nm ou moins dans une particule primaire est supposée être un point, le rapport du nombre de particules primaires dans lesquelles toutes les surfaces observées sont triangulaires au nombre total de particules primaires observées est inférieur à 40%. Dans l'isotherme d'adsorption de vapeur d'eau à 298 K, le rapport de la quantité d'adsorption de vapeur d'eau par volume unitaire de la poudre de structure organométallique à la quantité d'adsorption de vapeur d'eau par unité de volume de la structure de base MOF lorsque la pression relative est de 0,95 est de 84% ou plus.

金属有機構造体粉末を粉末ＸＲＤ分析した結果に基づいて、配位子として、配位のための官能基を２つ以上有する配位子のみを有する基本構造ＭＯＦを特定したときに、基本構造ＭＯＦが八面体の粒子形状をとる。粒子径が０．１μｍ以上であり少なくとも一つ以上の粒子面全体を観察できる一次粒子を１０個以上含むＳＥＭ像において、一次粒子における２０ｎｍ以下の長さの稜線を点と仮定したときに、観察される一次粒子の総数に対する、観察される面が全て三角形である一次粒子の数の割合が４０％未満である。２９８Ｋにおける水蒸気吸着等温線において、基本構造ＭＯＦについての相対圧力が０．９５のときの単位体積当たりの水蒸気吸着量に対する、金属有機構造体粉末についての単位体積当たりの水蒸気吸着量の比率が、８４％以上である。

APPARATUS FOR INCREASING GABA CONTENT OF TEA LEAVES, METHOD FOR INCREASING GABA CONTENT OF TEA LEAVES, AND METHOD FOR PRODUCING GABA TEA
茶葉のＧＡＢＡ含有量増大装置、茶葉のＧＡＢＡ含有量増大方法及びＧＡＢＡ茶の製造方法

extracted_name.value: カワサキ機工株式会社

abstract.text: Provided are an apparatus for increasing the GABA content of tea leaves, a method for increasing the GABA content of tea leaves, and a method for producing a GABA tea, by which it becomes possible to increase the GABA content in a short time and with a simple apparatus configuration.　The apparatus for increasing the GABA content of tea leaves is provided with: a low-temperature treatment means including a first low-temperature water vapor treatment means or a first low-temperature water immersion treatment means in which the temperature of the surface treatment of the tea leaves is maintained at a first temperature falling within the temperature range of 40-60°C for a predetermined set time; and a kill-green treatment means for deactivating an oxidation enzyme in the tea leaves that have been treated by the low-temperature treatment means.

L'invention concerne un appareil pour augmenter la teneur en GABA de feuilles de thé, un procédé pour augmenter la teneur en GABA de feuilles de thé, et un procédé de production d'un thé GABA, par lequel il devient possible d'augmenter la teneur en GABA en un court laps de temps et avec une configuration d'appareil simple.　L'appareil pour augmenter la teneur en GABA de feuilles de thé est pourvu : d'un moyen de traitement à basse température comprenant un premier moyen de traitement à la vapeur d'eau à basse température ou un premier moyen de traitement par immersion dans l'eau à basse température dans lequel la température du traitement de surface des feuilles de thé est maintenue à une première température se situant dans la plage de température allant de 40 à 60°C pendant une durée définie prédéterminée ; et d'un moyen de traitement de fixation (kill-green) pour désactiver une enzyme d'oxydation dans les feuilles de thé qui ont été traitées par le moyen de traitement à basse température.

短時間にかつ簡単な装置構成でＧＡＢＡ含有量を増大させることが可能な茶葉のＧＡＢＡ含有量増大装置、茶葉のＧＡＢＡ含有量増大方法及びＧＡＢＡ茶の製造方法を提供する。　茶葉のＧＡＢＡ含有量増大装置は、茶葉の表面の処理温度を、あらかじめ定めた設定時間の間、４０～６０℃の範囲の第１の温度に維持する第１の低温水蒸気処理手段又は第１の低温水浸漬処理手段を備えている低温処理手段と、この低温処理手段によって処理された茶葉の酸化酵素を失活する殺青処理手段とを備えている。

abstract.text: Provided in the present application are a display panel and a preparation method therefor, and a display apparatus. The display panel comprises a display area and a non-display area located on at least one side of the display area. The display panel comprises a substrate, a driving circuit, an inorganic layer, an organic layer and hydrophobic particles, wherein the substrate is located in the display area and the non-display area; the driving circuit is located in the non-display area; the inorganic layer is located on the side of the driving circuit away from the substrate, is located at least in the non-display area, and covers the driving circuit; the organic layer is located on the side of the inorganic layer away from the substrate, and is located in the display area and the non-display area; the organic layer is provided with at least one groove running through the organic layer, and the groove is located in the non-display area; and the hydrophobic particles are located on the side of the driving circuit away from the substrate, and are at least some of the hydrophobic particles are filled in the groove. In this way, the speed of water vapor eroding a display panel can be slowed down, thereby prolonging the service life of the display panel.

La présente demande concerne un écran d'affichage et son procédé de fabrication, ainsi qu'un appareil d'affichage. L'écran d'affichage comprend une zone d'affichage et une zone de non-affichage située sur au moins un côté de la zone d'affichage. L'écran d'affichage comprend un substrat, un circuit de pilotage, une couche inorganique, une couche organique et des particules hydrophobes, le substrat étant situé dans la zone d'affichage et la zone de non-affichage ; le circuit de pilotage est situé dans la zone de non-affichage ; la couche inorganique est située sur le côté du circuit de pilotage à l'opposé du substrat, est située au moins dans la zone de non-affichage, et recouvre le circuit de pilotage ; la couche organique est située sur le côté de la couche inorganique à l'opposé du substrat, et est située dans la zone d'affichage et la zone de non-affichage ; la couche organique est pourvue d'au moins une rainure s'étendant à travers la couche organique, et la rainure est située dans la zone de non-affichage ; et les particules hydrophobes sont situées du côté du circuit de pilotage à l'opposé du substrat, et au moins certaines des particules hydrophobes sont remplies dans la rainure. De cette manière, la vitesse d'érosion par la vapeur d'eau d'un écran d'affichage peut être ralentie, ce qui permet de prolonger la durée de vie de l'écran d'affichage.

本申请提供了一种显示面板及其制备方法和显示装置，该显示面板包括显示区以及至少位于显示区一侧的非显示区，显示面板包括衬底、驱动电路、无机层、有机层和疏水性颗粒。其中，衬底位于显示区和非显示区；驱动电路位于非显示区；无机层位于驱动电路远离衬底的一侧，至少位于非显示区，覆盖驱动电路；有机层位于无机层远离衬底的一侧，且位于显示区与非显示区；有机层设有至少一个贯穿有机层的凹槽，凹槽位于非显示区；疏水性颗粒位于驱动电路远离衬底的一侧，至少部分填充于凹槽内。可实现，延缓水汽侵蚀显示面板的速度，延长显示面板的使用寿命。

abstract.text: A zero liquid brine desalination and crystallization system includes a humidification dehumidification (HDH) desalination system and includes a crystallization system. The HDH system includes a humidifier configured to humidify a carrier gas using saline water, and a dehumidifier configured to dehumidify the carrier gas to obtain desalinated water. The crystallization system is configured to receive the saline water from the HDH desalination system and includes an evaporation chamber configured to produce salt crystals and water vapor from the saline water, and a condenser configured to condense the water vapor. Herein, the HDH desalination system and the crystallization system are connected at the condenser for heat exchange between the water vapor and at least one selected from the group consisting of the saline water and the carrier gas.

abstract.text: The present invention relates to modular ozone-based disinfection systems that generate hydroxyl radicals (·OH) from ozone and water vapor using a high-temperature catalyst module. The system includes a purification configuration with an air inlet, air circulation subsystem, airflow path, and air outlet, along with a water supply configuration feeding purified water to an electrolytic ozone generator. A catalyst module, such as a PTC heating element, heats ozone-containing air to a hydroxyl radical generation temperature, while a downstream hydroxyl augmentation and ozone reduction module converts residual ozone and conditions the airflow for safe discharge. Embodiments may include a replaceable water cartridge, resin tank, multiple water source options, humidity and purity sensors, and a safety interlock connected to a controller. The modular design supports portable, fixed, or refrigerated installations, enabling on-demand hydroxyl radical production with integrated control, safety, and discharge verification for advanced air and surface disinfection.

invention_title.text: STARK EFFECT POLARIZATION SPECTROSCOPY AND METHODS

abstract.text: A method of and system for monitoring the level of hydrogen peroxide gas in a system such as an isolation barrier. Gas is sampled from the system to a gas cell. The sampled gas may include hydrogen peroxide gas and water vapor. A laser beam from a laser source at a known polarization state is passed through the gas cell and the hydrogen peroxide gas and water vapor therein. An electrical field is created in the gas cell to reduce optical interference from water vapor while preserving the ability to more accurately measure the concentration of hydrogen peroxide gas in the gas cell. A change in the polarization state of the laser beam after passage through the gas cell is detected. Based on the detected change in the polarization state of the laser beam, the concentration of the hydrogen peroxide gas in the gas cell is determined.

abstract.text: The present application discloses a red phosphor, and a preparation method and an application thereof and relates to the field of luminescent material technology. The chemical composition of the red phosphor is A2M(1-x)F6:xMn4+. The A is selected from at least one of alkali metal elements, and the M is selected from at least one of IVA group elements or a Ti element and a value range of the x is 0<x≤0.05. The red phosphor is granular; and a concentration of tetravalent manganese ions in a radial direction from a center of a particle of the red phosphor to a surface of the particle of the red phosphor decreases gradually. In the present application, the concentration of the activator Mn4+ in a radial direction from the center of the particle of the red phosphor to its surface is set to a descending gradient distribution to buffer the phosphor powder from the erosion of water vapor, thereby improving its anti-aging performance and prolonging the service life.

abstract.text: An environmental energy converter includes a housing having an upper portion and a lower portion. The lower housing portion has a hydrophobic material portion. The upper portion has a vent opening in fluid communication with the environment. The housing contains a hygroscopic mass within the lower housing portion that is in fluid communication with the hydrophobic material portion. An ion-electrode conducting membrane assembly is coupled to the housing to allow the passage of ionized water or water vapor through the ion-electrode conducting membrane and into contact with the hygroscopic solution. An air duct may be coupled to the housing to provide an airflow to the ion-electrode conducting membrane and/or to the hydrophobic material portion.

Un convertidor de energía ambiental incluye un alojamiento que tiene una porción superior y una porción inferior. La porción inferior de alojamiento tiene una porción de material hidrofóbico. La porción superior tiene una abertura de ventilación en comunicación fluida con el ambiente. El alojamiento contiene una masa de higroscópico dentro de la porción inferior de alojamiento que está en comunicación fluida con la porción de material hidrofóbico. Un montaje de membrana conductora de iones-electrodos se acopla al alojamiento para permitir el paso de agua ionizada o vapor de agua a través de la membrana conductora de iones-electrodos y hacia el contacto con la solución higroscópica. Un conducto de aire se puede acoplar al alojamiento para proporcionar un flujo de aire a la membrana conductora de iones-electrodos y/o a la porción de material hidrofóbico.

invention_title.text: PROCESO Y COMPOSICION PARA LA PRODUCCION DE CONCRETO POLIMERICO UTILIZANDO AGUA CON SAL COMO MEDIO DE REACCION.
PROCESO Y COMPOSICION PARA LA PRODUCCION DE CONCRETO POLIMERICO UTILIZANDO AGUA CON SAL COMO MEDIO DE REACCION.

abstract.text: The present invention relates to an innovative process and composition for the manufacture of polymeric concrete using a salt water solution as a reaction medium. This approach replaces the glycols derived from fossil fuels, achieving a significant reduction in production costs between 30% and 40% and promoting environmental sustainability by generating water vapor as a reusable byproduct and allowing the recovery of up to 90% of the salt used. The composition includes an unsaturated polyester resin obtained from recycled PET bottles, styrene monomer, granulates and recycled sand, in addition to advanced additives such as graphene oxide, carbon black, and calcium carbonate, which together optimize the mechanical properties of the concrete. The production process incorporates ultrasonic dispersion technologies to ensure a homogeneous mixture and efficient integration of nanometer materials, improving tensile strength, compression, and chemical agents. This polymeric concrete is characterized by its versatility and sustainability, being applicable in sectors such as road infrastructure, sustainable construction, industrial environments, coastal structures and advanced architectures. In addition, the formulation thereof allows applications in paints, waterproofing agents, composite materials, decorative moulds, repairs, electronics, synthetic fibres, 3D printing and consumer goods, highlighting the adaptability thereof to different technical and industrial needs.

La presente invención se refiere a un proceso y una composición innovadores para la fabricación de concreto polimérico que utiliza una solución de agua con sal como medio de reacción. Este enfoque sustituye a los glicoles derivados de combustibles fósiles, logrando una significativa reducción de costos de producción entre un 30% y 40% y promoviendo la sostenibilidad ambiental al generar vapor de agua como subproducto reutilizable y permitir la recuperación de hasta el 90% de la sal empleada. La composición incluye una resina poliéster insaturada obtenida de botellas de PET recicladas, monómero de estireno, granulados y arena reciclados, además de aditivos avanzados como óxido de grafeno, negro de humo, y carbonato de calcio, que juntos optimizan las propiedades mecánicas del concreto. El proceso de producción incorpora tecnologías de dispersión ultrasónica para asegurar una mezcla homogénea y una integración eficiente de materiales nanométricos, mejorando la resistencia a la tracción, compresión, y agentes químicos. Este concreto polimérico se caracteriza por su versatilidad y sostenibilidad, siendo aplicable en sectores como la infraestructura vial, la construcción sostenible, entornos industriales, estructuras costeras y arquitecturas avanzadas. Adicionalmente, su formulación permite aplicaciones en pinturas, impermeabilizantes, materiales compuestos, moldes decorativos, reparaciones, electrónica, fibras sintéticas, impresión 3D y artículos de consumo, destacando su adaptabilidad a diversas necesidades técnicas e industriales.

invention_title.text: MULTILAYER TEXTILE ASSEMBLIES FOR REVERSIBLE WATER VAPOR ABSORPTION
CONJUNTOS TEXTILES MULTICAPA PARA ABSORCION REVERSIBLE DE VAPOR DE AGUA

abstract.text: Described herein are multilayer moisture management assemblies for reversible absorption of water vapor where the assemblies regulate relative humidity in microclimates proximate the assemblies. The moisture management assemblies absorb water vapor from air when the relative humidity level in the air is at or above a threshold level, thus retarding further elevation of the relative humidity. Articles incorporating the assemblies are also disclosed.

Se describen aquí conjuntos multicapa de gestión de la humedad que permiten la absorción reversible del vapor de agua y regulan la humedad relativa en microclimas próximos a los conjuntos. Los conjuntos para la gestión de la humedad absorben el vapor de agua del aire cuando el nivel de humedad relativa del aire alcanza o supera un nivel umbral, lo que retrasa un aumento adicional de la humedad relativa. También se describen artículos que incorporan los conjuntos.

invention_title.text: GRAPHENE OXIDE COMPOSITE MEMBRANES

abstract.text: A system involves interleaving high aspect ratio, rod-like aldehyde-modified cellulose nanomaterials (ACN) between graphene oxide (GO) sheets and utilizing crosslinkers to create a dense, crosslinked network that is highly permeable and selective to a molecule of interest, especially water and water vapor, and does not delaminate in water. This system, especially when combined with oxidative surface treatment of a membrane support substrate, leads to improved adhesion of the membrane on the substrate.

invention_title.text: FUEL CELL SYSTEM AND CONTROL METHOD OF FUEL CELL SYSTEM

abstract.text: A control method of a fuel cell system according to the present disclosure uses a fuel cell system including a raw material supply system configured to supply a raw material, a water vapor supply system configured to supply water vapor to the raw material supply system, a fuel cell configured to generate electric energy from hydrogen generated from the raw material and an oxidizing agent, and a recycle gas system configured to circulate a recycle gas, which is at least a part of an anode off-gas discharged from an anode of the fuel cell, to the raw material supply system. A flow rate of water vapor flowing through the water vapor supply system is controlled in accordance with a flow rate of carbon dioxide contained in the recycle gas flowing through the recycle gas system.

abstract.text: A protective layered body including: a first substrate layer; and a first release layer disposed in contact with one surface or both surfaces of the first substrate layer, wherein the first substrate layer is a layer formed of a resin containing a polymer and having a water vapor transmission rate at 40° C. and 90% Rh of smaller than 1 g/m2/day when the first substrate layer is assumed to have a thickness of 100 μm. Also provided is a composite layered body including the protective layered body and a resin layer (R) disposed on the protective layered body to be in contact with a surface thereof on a side of the release layer, wherein, when the resin layer (R) is left to stand in an environment at 25° C. and 50% Rh for 2 hours, a weight change ratio of the resin layer (R) is 0.5% or more.

abstract.text: A paving membrane (1) includes a flexible plastic layer impermeable to water and water vapor (4) of the film-like plastic having a top side (5) and a bottom side (6) and an anchor layer (11) firmly attached to the bottom side (6) of the plastic layer (4). The plastic layer includes a plurality of buttons (7) present on the top side, each of the buttons forming a button cavity (8) on the bottom side. Water or water vapour discharge channels (9) are formed on the underside of the plastic layer (4). A maximum height (hmax) of the membrane (1) is at most about 5 mm, and at least 200 buttons per 10 cm2 are provided in areas having buttons (7).

Una membrana de pavimentado (1) incluye una capa plástica flexible impermeable al agua y al vapor de agua (4) del plástico similar a película que tiene un lado superior (5) y un lado inferior (6) y una capa de anclaje (11) unida firmemente al lado inferior (6) de la capa plástica (4). La capa plástica incluye una pluralidad de botones (7) presentes en el lado superior, cada uno de los botones forma una cavidad de botón (8) en el lado inferior. Se forman canales de descarga de agua o de vapor de agua (9) en el lado inferior de la capa plástica (4). Una altura máxima (hmax) de la membrana (1) es como máximo aproximadamente 5 mm, y por lo menos 200 botones por 10 cm2 se proporcionan en áreas que tienen botones (7).

abstract.text: In a hydrogen boiler (3), hydrogen gas and oxygen gas supplied from a water electrolysis device (2), which generates the hydrogen gas and the oxygen gas by electrolyzing water, are combusted in a combustion chamber of the hydrogen boiler (3), and a water pipe of the hydrogen boiler (3) is heated, thus generating water vapor.

Dans une chaudière à hydrogène (3), de l'hydrogène gazeux et du gaz oxygène fournis par un dispositif d'électrolyse de l'eau (2), qui génère l'hydrogène gazeux et le gaz oxygène par électrolyse de l'eau, sont brûlés dans une chambre de combustion de la chaudière à hydrogène (3), et un tuyau d'eau de la chaudière à hydrogène (3) est chauffé, générant ainsi de la vapeur d'eau.
水素ボイラ（３）は、水を電気分解して水素ガスと酸素ガスとを生成する水電解装置（２）から供給された水素ガスと酸素ガスとを水素ボイラ（３）の燃焼室において燃焼させ水素ボイラ（３）の水管を加熱して水蒸気を生成する。

PYROLYSIS AND GASIFICATION SYSTEM AND APPARATUS FOR PRODUCING SYNTHESIS GAS

abstract.text: Provided are a system and apparatus for pyrolysis and gasification of waste for synthesis gas production. In this waste gasification treatment apparatus in which waste is introduced into a reduction furnace and gasified, the reduction furnace comprises: a waste treatment space including an upper treatment space in which waste is gasified and which is located at an upper portion, a lower treatment space located at a lower portion, and a central treatment space separating the upper treatment space and the lower treatment space and having a diameter smaller than the diameter of the lower treatment space and the upper treatment space; a slag discharge unit through which slag is discharged from the lower end of the reduction furnace; a gas discharge unit through which gas is discharged from the upper end of the reduction furnace; a plurality of upper burners which supply oxygen to the upper treatment space; and a plurality of lower burners which supply oxygen and water vapor to the lower treatment space.

Sont proposés un système et un appareil de pyrolyse et de gazéification de déchets pour la production de gaz de synthèse. Dans cet appareil de traitement de gazéification de déchets dans lequel des déchets sont introduits dans un four de réduction et gazéifiés, le four de réduction comprend : un espace de traitement de déchets comprenant un espace de traitement supérieur dans lequel des déchets sont gazéifiés et qui est situé au niveau d'une partie supérieure, un espace de traitement inférieur situé au niveau d'une partie inférieure, et un espace de traitement central séparant l'espace de traitement supérieur et l'espace de traitement inférieur et ayant un diamètre inférieur au diamètre de l'espace de traitement inférieur et de l'espace de traitement supérieur ; une unité d'évacuation de scories à travers laquelle les scories sont évacuées de l'extrémité inférieure du four de réduction ; une unité d'évacuation de gaz à travers laquelle le gaz est évacué de l'extrémité supérieure du four de réduction ; une pluralité de brûleurs supérieurs qui fournissent de l'oxygène à l'espace de traitement supérieur ; et une pluralité de brûleurs inférieurs qui fournissent de l'oxygène et de la vapeur d'eau à l'espace de traitement inférieur.

합성가스 생산을 위한 폐기물의 열분해·가스화 시스템 및 장치를 제공한다. 폐기물의 가스화 처리 장치는 폐기물이 환원로 내에 투입되어 가스화 처리되는 폐기물의 가스화 처리 장치에 있어서, 환원로는 내측에 폐기물이 가스화되며 상부에 위치하는 상단 처리공간, 하부에 위치하는 하단 처리공간 및 상단 처리공간과 하단 처리공간을 구분하되 하단 처리공간과 상단 처리공간의 직경에 비해 더 작은 직경을 갖는 중심 처리공간을 포함하는 폐기물 처리공간, 환원로 하단에서 슬래그가 배출되는 슬래그 배출부, 환원로 상단에서 가스가 배출되는 가스 배출부, 상단 처리공간으로 산소를 공급하는 복수의 상단버너, 및 하단 처리공간으로 산소 및 수증기를 공급하는 복수의 하단버너를 포함한다.

invention_title.text: FILM MULTICOUCHE DÉPOSÉ EN PHASE VAPEUR, STRUCTURE MULTICOUCHE, MATÉRIAU D'EMBALLAGE, COMPOSITION DE RÉCUPÉRATION ET PROCÉDÉ DE RECYCLAGE
VAPOR-DEPOSITED MULTILAYER FILM, MULTILAYER STRUCTURE, PACKAGING MATERIAL, RECOVERY COMPOSITION, AND RECYCLING METHOD
蒸着多層フィルム、多層構造体、包装材、回収組成物及びリサイクル方法

abstract.text: The present invention provides: a vapor-deposited multilayer film which has high oxygen barrier properties and high water vapor barrier properties, and has sufficient oxygen barrier properties even after a bending treatment; and the like. Provided is a vapor-deposited multilayer film comprising: a multilayer film in which a layer (A), as the outermost layer, a layer (B), and a layer (C) are stacked in this order; and a vapor-deposited inorganic layer (I) stacked on the exposed surface side of the layer (A). The vapor-deposited inorganic layer (I) is a vapor-deposited metal layer that is mainly composed of aluminum, or a vapor-deposited inorganic oxide layer that is mainly composed of alumina or silica. The layer (A) contains, as a main component, an ethylene-vinyl alcohol copolymer (a) that has an ethylene unit content of 36-60 mol%; the layer (B) contains, as a main component, an ethylene-vinyl alcohol copolymer (b) that has an ethylene unit content of 20-35 mol%; and the layer (C) contains a polyethylene or a polypropylene as a main component. The average thickness of the multilayer film is 300 µm or less.

La présente invention concerne : un film multicouche déposé en phase vapeur qui présente des propriétés barrière à l'oxygène élevées et des propriétés barrière à la vapeur d'eau élevées, ainsi que des propriétés barrière à l'oxygène suffisantes même après un traitement de cintrage ; et similaire. L'invention concerne un film multicouche déposé en phase vapeur comprenant : un film multicouche dans lequel une couche (A), en tant que couche externe, une couche (B) et une couche (C) sont empilées dans cet ordre ; et une couche inorganique déposée en phase vapeur (I) empilée sur le côté surface exposée de la couche (A). La couche inorganique déposée en phase vapeur (I) est une couche métallique déposée en phase vapeur qui est principalement composée d'aluminium, ou une couche d'oxyde inorganique déposée en phase vapeur qui est principalement composée d'oxyde d'aluminium ou d'oxyde de silicium. La couche (A) contient, comme composant principal, un copolymère éthylène-alcool vinylique (a) qui a une teneur en unités éthylène de 36 à 60 % en moles ; la couche (B) contient, comme composant principal, un copolymère éthylène-alcool vinylique (b) qui a une teneur en unités éthylène de 20 à 35 % en moles ; et la couche (C) contient un polyéthylène ou un polypropylène comme composant principal. L'épaisseur moyenne du film multicouche est inférieure ou égale à 300 µm.

酸素バリア性及び水蒸気バリア性が高く、屈曲処理後も十分な酸素バリア性を有する蒸着多層フィルム等の提供。層（Ａ）を最表層に有し、層（Ａ）、層（Ｂ）及び層（Ｃ）がこの順に積層された多層フィルムと、層（Ａ）の表出面側に積層された、アルミニウムを主成分とする金属蒸着層又はアルミナ若しくはシリカを主成分とする無機酸化物蒸着層である無機蒸着層（Ｉ）とを備え、層（Ａ）が、エチレン単位含有量が３６～６０ｍｏｌ％であるエチレン－ビニルアルコール共重合体（ａ）を主成分として含み、層（Ｂ）が、エチレン単位含有量が２０～３５ｍｏｌ％であるエチレン－ビニルアルコール共重合体（ｂ）を主成分として含み、層（Ｃ）が、ポリエチレン又はポリプロピレンを主成分として含み、上記多層フィルムの平均厚みが３００μｍ以下である、蒸着多層フィルム。

invention_title.text: STRATIFIÉ FORMANT UNE BARRIÈRE AUX GAZ
GAS BARRIER LAMINATE
ガスバリア性積層体

extracted_name.value: 王子ホールディングス株式会社

abstract.text: This gas barrier laminate comprises: a paper substrate; and, in order on at least one surface of the paper substrate, an oxygen barrier layer and a water vapor barrier layer. The oxygen barrier layer contains a water-soluble resin and an inorganic compound having an aspect ratio of 50 or less and an average particle diameter of 3 μm or less; the water-soluble resin contains at least one selected from the group consisting of polyvinyl alcohols and modified polyvinyl alcohols having a saponification degree of 93% or more; the content of the inorganic compound is 150 to 540 parts by mass with respect to 100 parts by mass of the water-soluble resin; and the water vapor barrier layer contains a water dispersible resin.

La présente invention concerne un stratifié formant une barrière aux gaz comprenant : un substrat en papier ; et, dans l'ordre sur au moins une surface du substrat en papier, une couche barrière à l'oxygène et une couche barrière à la vapeur d'eau. La couche barrière à l'oxygène contient une résine soluble dans l'eau et un composé inorganique ayant un rapport d'aspect inférieur ou égal à 50 et un diamètre de particule moyen inférieur ou égal à 3 µm ; la résine soluble dans l'eau contient au moins un élément choisi dans le groupe constitué par les alcools polyvinyliques et les alcools polyvinyliques modifiés ayant un degré de saponification supérieur ou égal à 93 % ; la teneur du composé inorganique est de 150 à 540 parties en masse par rapport à 100 parties en masse de la résine soluble dans l'eau ; et la couche barrière à la vapeur d'eau contient une résine dispersible dans l'eau.

紙基材と、該紙基材の少なくとも一方の面上に、酸素バリア層と水蒸気バリア層とをこの順に有するガスバリア性積層体であって、前記酸素バリア層が、水溶性樹脂と、アスペクト比が５０以下かつ平均粒子径が３μｍ以下である無機化合物とを含有し、前記水溶性樹脂が、ケン化度が９３％以上の、ポリビニルアルコールおよび変性ポリビニルアルコールよりなる群から選ばれる少なくとも１種を含有し、前記無機化合物の含有量が、前記水溶性樹脂１００質量部に対して１５０質量部以上５４０質量部以下であり、前記水蒸気バリア層が水分散性樹脂を含有する、ガスバリア性積層体。

invention_title.text: PROCÉDÉ ET DISPOSITIF POUR LA FOURNITURE DE VAPEUR D'EAU À UNE CONDUITE DE REFOULEMENT PRIMAIRE
METHOD AND DEVICE FOR SUPPLYING WATER VAPOR TO FORELINE
フォアラインへの水蒸気供給方法及びその装置

extracted_name.value: BEIJING KANKEN ENVIRONMENTAL PROT EQUIPMENT CO LTD [CN]
カンケンテクノ株式会社,
北京康肯▲環▼保▲設▼▲備▼有限公司

abstract.text: The present invention is a method for supplying water vapor to a foreline (12) when an exhaust gas (E) to be detoxified, which is discharged from a semiconductor fabrication process, is decomposed by a plasma source (14) provided in the foreline (12), characterized by supplying, to a location along the foreline (12) where the pressure is 400 Pa or less, water vapor generated by adjusting water (W) to a water temperature between 10°C and 35°C, inclusive.

La présente invention concerne un procédé de fourniture de vapeur d'eau à une conduite de refoulement primaire (12) lorsqu'un gaz d'échappement (E) à détoxifier, qui est évacué d'un processus de fabrication de semi-conducteur, est décomposé par une source de plasma (14) disposée dans la conduite de refoulement primaire (12), caractérisé en ce qu'il fournit, à un emplacement le long de la conduite de refoulement primaire (12) où la pression est de 400 Pa ou moins, de la vapeur d'eau générée par la régulation de l'eau (W) à une température d'eau comprise entre 10 °C et 35 °C, inclus.
本発明は、半導体製造プロセスより排出される除害対象排ガス(Ｅ)をフォアライン(１２)に設けたプラズマ源(１４)で分解する際に、そのフォアライン(１２)へ水蒸気を供給する方法であって、上記フォアライン(１２)の圧力が４００Ｐａ以下の箇所に、水(Ｗ)を水温１０℃以上で且つ３５℃以下に調整して発生させた水蒸気を供給することを特徴とする。

invention_title.text: DISPOSITIF D'ÉLIMINATION D'HUILE UTILISANT LA CHALEUR ET LA FORCE CENTRIFUGE
OIL REMOVAL DEVICE USING HEAT AND CENTRIFUGAL FORCE
열과 원심력을 이용한 기름제거 장치

abstract.text: This oil removal device using heat and centrifugal force can efficiently remove oil by using heat and centrifugal force, and thus can improve the taste and texture of fried food. In addition, a plurality of baskets formed to have step differences are used to prevent fried food from clumping together, and oil is removed while discharging oil vapor and water vapor through an air vent, thereby making it possible to minimize the reabsorption of oil separated from fried food into other fried food.

L'invention concerne un dispositif d'élimination d'huile utilisant la chaleur et la force centrifuge qui peut éliminer efficacement l'huile en utilisant la chaleur et la force centrifuge, et peut ainsi améliorer le goût et la texture d'aliments frits. De plus, une pluralité de paniers formés pour présenter des différences de niveau sont utilisés pour empêcher les aliments frits de s'agglomérer, et l'huile est éliminée tout en évacuant la vapeur d'huile et la vapeur d'eau à travers un évent d'air, ce qui permet de réduire au minimum la réabsorption d'huile séparée d'aliments frits dans d'autres aliments frits.

열과 원심력을 이용한 기름제거 장치는 열과 원심력을 이용하여 효율적인 기름 제거가 가능하여, 튀김물의 맛과 식감을 향상시킬 수 있다. 또한, 단차지게 형성된 복수의 바스켓을 이용하여 튀김물이 뭉쳐지지 않도록 하고, 송풍구를 통해 유증기와 수증기를 배출하면서 기름을 제거함으로써, 튀김물로부터 분리된 기름이 다시 다른 튀김물로 흡수되는 것을 최소화할 수 있다.

OUTER PACKAGING MATERIAL FOR VACUUM HEAT-INSULATING MATERIAL, VACUUM HEAT-INSULATING MATERIAL, ARTICLE WITH VACUUM HEAT-INSULATING MATERIAL, AND METHOD FOR PRODUCING OUTER PACKAGING MATERIAL FOR VACUUM HEAT-INSULATING MATERIAL

abstract.text: The present disclosure provides an outer packaging material for a vacuum heat-insulating material, the outer packaging material having a water vapor permeability of 0.1 g/(m2·day) or less and an oxygen permeability of 0.1 cc/(m2·day·atm) or less. The outer packaging material for a vacuum heat-insulating material has a plane-direction thermal diffusivity α and a thickness T which satisfy the following (expression 1). Expression 1: α≤6.375×10-5/(T×V) (In the expression, α is the plane-direction thermal diffusivity (m2/s) of the outer packaging material for a vacuum heat-insulating material, T is the thickness (m) of the outer packaging material for a vacuum heat-insulating material, and V is the volumetric specific heat of the outer packaging material for a vacuum heat-insulating material and is 2.2×106 J/(m3·K) to 2.4×106 J/(m3·K).)

La présente divulgation concerne un matériau d'emballage externe pour un matériau d'isolation thermique sous vide, le matériau d'emballage externe ayant une perméabilité à la vapeur d'eau de 0,1 g/(m2·jour) ou inférieure et une perméabilité à l'oxygène de 0,1 cc/(m2·jour·atm) ou inférieure. Le matériau d'emballage externe pour un matériau d'isolation thermique sous vide présente une diffusivité thermique dans le sens plan α et une épaisseur T qui satisfont à ce qui suit (expression 1). Expression 1 : α ≤ 6 ̳375 × 10-5/(T×V) (Dans l'expression, α est la diffusivité thermique dans le sens plan (m2/s) du matériau d'emballage externe pour un matériau d'isolation thermique sous vide, T est l'épaisseur (m) du matériau d'emballage externe pour un matériau d'isolation thermique sous vide, et V est la chaleur spécifique volumétrique du matériau d'emballage externe pour un matériau d'isolation thermique sous vide et est de 2,2 × 106 J/(m3·K) à 2,4 × 106 J/(m3·K).)

invention_title.text: MULTI-FUNCTIONAL ANALGESIC-RELEASING WOUND DRESSING

abstract.text: A wound dressing including a porous biosynthetic polymer film comprising a poly(lactide-co-caprolactone) (“PLC”) copolymer or other suitable polymer matrix, and a local analgesic loaded therein, to provide pain relief over an extended period of time (e.g., for 5-7 days), e.g., for healing of a partial thickness dermal injury. The PLC copolymer may have a particular lactide/caprolactone molar ratio (e.g., from 2:1 to 9:1) to ensure slow, sustained release of the bupivacaine or other analgesic. The dressing may provide a water vapor transmission rate from 1000 g/m2·day to 3000 g/m2·day to facilitate fast healing and regrowth of new epithelial tissue beneath the dressing. The dressing is configured to remain positioned over the dermal injury, providing wound protection for about 14 days, after which is simply debrides away, falls off, or is easily and painlessly removed, once new epithelial tissue regrows.

invention_title.text: Atmospheric correction

extracted_name.value: COMMONWEALTH SCIENT AND INDUSTRIAL RESEARCH ORGANISATION [AU]
COMMONWEALTH SCIENTIFIC AND INDUSTRIAL RESEARCH ORGANISATION

abstract.text: This disclosure relates to machine learning models for performing atmospheric correction on an input image. To train a machine learning model to perform atmospheric correction on an input image comprising atmospheric distortion, a processor applies a first trained machine learning model to a training image to determine a first output image, the first trained machine learning model being configured to perform atmospheric correction on an input image comprising atmospheric distortion. The processor applies a second machine learning model to the training image to determine a second output image, wherein the second machine learning model has a smaller model architecture than the first trained machine learning model. The processor trains the second machine learning model by minimising a loss based on the first output image and the second output image to determine a second trained machine learning model. This disclosure relates to machine learning models for performing atmospheric correction on an input image. To train a machine learning model to perform atmospheric correction on an input image comprising atmospheric distortion, a processor applies a first trained machine learning model to a training image to determine a first output image, the first trained machine learning model being configured to perform atmospheric correction on an input image comprising atmospheric distortion. The processor applies a second machine learning model to the training image to determine a second output image, wherein the second machine learning model has a smaller model architecture than the first trained machine learning model. abstract.text: The present disclosure relates to a modular converter for continuous conversion of water vapor into electricity comprising: a porous matrix comprising compressed metal oxide nanopowder, wherein the porous matrix, is covered from first side by the functional layer, which partially may infuse in the porous matrix, preferably an aluminum phosphate; a layer of carbon electrode, preferably a layer of graphite on the active layer, metal or carbon current collectors on carbon electrode layer and layer of metal Au, Ag, Al, Cu, Fe, Zn, Mg, Li, Ni, Co, Ti, Zr, Sn, Cr, Y, Nb, Mo, Rd, Pt, Cd, Hf, Ta, W, C or their alloys. Schottky contact on the second side of the converter; and metal or carbon current collectors, on the layer of Schottky contact, wherein the second surface of the converter is directly opposite the first surface of the converter.

미세먼지 저감·수증기 증발·잠열 재활용 쓰리이펙트형 스마트 산업용 보일러 배기가스 순환루프 형성제어장치 및 방법

abstract.text: 본 발명에서는 기존 산업용 보일러 배기가스내 수증기의 경우에, 백연 발생, 오염물질 확산 방행, 2차 입자상 물질 생성 촉진, 에어로졸을 활성화시키는 문제점과, 보일러 배기가스의 경우에, 대기 중에 냉각되면서 응축시 미세먼지(PM2.5)를 생성시키는데, 이는 지름이 2.5㎛(마이크로미터, 1㎛=100만분의 1m) 이하인 초미세먼지로서, 크기가 작아 호흡기를 통해 폐와 혈관까지 침투하여 건강에 심각한 영향을 미치기 때문에, 탄소배출권 시장에서 권고하고, 미국 EPA (μg/m³) 기준 연평균 12 μg/m³ 이하로 생성시킬 수 있는 보일러 배기가스용 미세먼지 저감장치개발이 시급한 문제점을 개선하고자, 하이브리드형 배기열 회수 모듈(100), 저온 배기열 회수 흡수탑모듈(200), 스마트 증류탑 순환루프 형성모듈(300), 시상수·응축수 탱크부(400), 스마트제어부(500)로 구성됨으로서, 하이브리드형 배기열 회수 모듈을 통해, 현열과 잠열을 동시 회수하는 하이브리드 방식으로 적용하여, 기존보다 30~50% 이상의 배기열 회수 효율을 향상시킬 수 있고, 배기열 회수량이 증가함에 따라 보일러 연료 소모량을 20% 이상 절감시킬 수 있으며, 난방뿐만 아니라 냉방, 온수 공급까지 동시에 가능하여, 에너지원 활용의 범위를 넓힐 수 있고, 배기 가스 중 포함된 미세먼지(입자상물질, PM)와 수증기 응축이 용이하여, 탄소배출권 시장에도 미세먼지 저감장치로서 경쟁력있게 적용시킬 수 있고, 저온 배기열 회수 흡수탑모듈이 구성됨으로서, 하이브리드형 배기열 회수 모듈과 연계하여 현열 + 잠열을 동시에 회수하는 방식을 적용함으로써, 기존보다 낮은 온도 20~40℃ 에서도 배기열을 회수시킬 수 있고, 흡수제 직접 분사로 노점온도 하강 및 배기열 손실 최소화시킬 수 있으며, 4단형 흡수탑 구조로 흡수 효율을 기존보다 80% 향상시킬 수 있고, 기존에는 흡수제의 재사용이 어려워 운영 비용이 높았으나, 본 발명에서는 흡수제 재생 시스템을 포함하여 흡수제의 지속적인 사용이 가능하므로 경제성이 뛰어난 효과가 있고, 스마트 증류탑 순환루프 형성모듈을 통해, 저온 배기열 회수 흡수탑모듈을 활용하여, 폐열을 회수하여 저농도 흡수제를 예열하고, 낮은 온도에서도 증발이 가능하도록 감압 분위기를 형성시켜, 기존 대비 기존 대비 30~50% 이상의 에너지 절감 효과를 기대할 수 있고, 감압 분위기 내에서 증발 촉진 및 증류 속도를 기존에 비해, 1.5배~2배 향상시킬 수 있으며, 농축 흡수제 냉각기와 농축 흡수제 가열기를 활용하여 적절한 온도로 순환시킴으로써, 흡수제의 성능 저하를 방지하고 흡수제의 사용 수명을 기존보다 1.5배~3배 길게 연장시킬 수 있고, 증발된 수증기의 응축수를 시상수·응축수 탱크부로 이동하여 재사용될 수 있어, 수자원 절약율을 기존에 비해 80% 향상시킬 수 있으며, 스마트제어부가 구성됨으로서, 하이브리드형 배기열 회수 제어모드를 통해, 배기가스의 현열(150~120°C)과 잠열(40~20°C)을 동시에 회수하여 실내 난방 및 온수 공급에 재활용시킬 수 있고,단순히 공기를 데우는 것이 아니라, 배기열을 최대한 활용하여 냉난방 시스템의 에너지 효율을 기존에 비해 80% 향상시킬 수 있으며, 산업용 가스보일러의 백연 제거와 동시에 미세먼지(여과성+응축성)를 80% 이상 제거시킬 수 있고, 보일러 배기가스에 포함된 수분 제거율을 80% 이상 제거시킬 수 있는 미세먼지 저감·수증기 증발·잠열 재활용 쓰리이펙트형 스마트 산업용 보일러 배기가스 순환루프 형성제어장치 및 방법을 제공하는데 그 목적이 있다.

abstract.text: A water generation system includes a housing having a surface to collect solar radiation; a sorption layer comprising a hygroscopic material to capture water vapor from a process gas during a sorption mode and release water vapor to a regeneration fluid during a desorption mode; and a thermally insulative transparent layer disposed above or upstream of the hygroscopic material to allow solar radiation to pass therethrough to the hygroscopic material and reduce thermal conductance from the hygroscopic material to the external environment. Generating water includes allowing solar radiation to pass through a thermally insulative transparent layer to a hygroscopic material; directing a regeneration fluid in a regeneration flow path to collect heat from the thermally insulative transparent layer and transfer collected heat to the hygroscopic material to release water vapor to the regeneration fluid; and condensing, via a heat exchange assembly, water vapor from the regeneration fluid.

L'invention concerne un système de génération d'eau qui comprend un carter présentant une surface pour collecter un rayonnement solaire ; une couche de sorption comprenant un matériau hygroscopique pour capturer la vapeur d'eau à partir d'un gaz de traitement pendant un mode de sorption et libérer de la vapeur d'eau vers un fluide de régénération pendant un mode de désorption ; et une couche transparente thermiquement isolante disposée au-dessus ou en amont du matériau hygroscopique pour permettre au rayonnement solaire de passer à travers celui-ci vers le matériau hygroscopique et réduire la conductance thermique du matériau hygroscopique à l'environnement externe. La génération d'eau consiste à permettre au rayonnement solaire de passer à travers une couche transparente thermiquement isolante vers un matériau hygroscopique ; à diriger un fluide de régénération dans un trajet d'écoulement de régénération pour collecter la chaleur provenant de la couche transparente thermiquement isolante et à transférer la chaleur collectée au matériau hygroscopique pour libérer la vapeur d'eau vers le fluide de régénération ; et à condenser, par l'intermédiaire d'un ensemble d'échange de chaleur, la vapeur d'eau provenant du fluide de régénération.

abstract.text: A hydrophobic/chromium-rich corrosion-resistant composite coating, a preparation method therefor, and the use thereof, relating to the technical field of material surface coatings. The preparation method comprises: preheating a workpiece; applying a coating slurry to the surface of the preheated workpiece, and performing drying and curing and sintering treatment to obtain a chromium-rich corrosion-resistant coating on the surface of the workpiece, the coating slurry comprising a solid-phase component and a liquid-phase component, wherein the solid-phase component comprises chromium powder, nickel powder, iron powder and a rare earth compound, and the liquid-phase component comprises Al(H2PO4)3, water glass, an ammonium halide, polyvinyl alcohol and Cr2O3; and spray-coating a layer of a superhydrophobic material on the surface of the chromium-rich corrosion-resistant coating, and then performing curing treatment to obtain the hydrophobic/chromium-rich corrosion-resistant composite coating. A workpiece undergoes chromizing treatment and superhydrophobic treatment and thus possesses corrosion resistance, wear resistance and hydrophobic properties, so that water vapor in tubes cannot stay on the inner walls of the tubes, thereby preventing corrosion of the inner walls of the tubes, improving the comprehensive performance of the tubes, and prolonging the service life.

L'invention concerne un revêtement composite hydrophobe/résistant à la corrosion riche en chrome, son procédé de préparation et son utilisation, se rapportant au domaine technique des revêtements de surface de matériau. Le procédé de préparation consiste : à préchauffer une pièce ; à appliquer une suspension de revêtement sur la surface de la pièce préchauffée, et à effectuer un traitement de séchage, de durcissement et de frittage afin d'obtenir un revêtement résistant à la corrosion riche en chrome sur la surface de la pièce, la suspension de revêtement comprenant un composant en phase solide et un composant en phase liquide, le composant en phase solide comprenant de la poudre de chrome, de la poudre de nickel, de la poudre de fer et un composé de terre rare, et le composant en phase liquide comprenant Al(H2PO4)3, du verre soluble, un halogénure d'ammonium, de l'alcool polyvinylique et Cr2O3 ; et à revêtir par pulvérisation une couche d'un matériau superhydrophobe sur la surface du revêtement résistant à la corrosion riche en chrome, puis à effectuer un traitement de durcissement afin d'obtenir le revêtement composite hydrophobe/résistant à la corrosion riche en chrome. Une pièce subit un traitement de chromisation et un traitement superhydrophobe et possède ainsi une résistance à la corrosion, une résistance à l'usure et des propriétés hydrophobes, de sorte que la vapeur d'eau dans des tubes ne peut pas rester sur les parois internes des tubes, ce qui prévient la corrosion des parois internes des tubes, améliore les performances globales des tubes, et prolonge la durée de vie.

一种疏水/富铬耐腐蚀复合涂层及其制备方法、应用，属于材料表面涂层技术领域。制备方法包括：对工件预热处理；将涂覆料浆涂覆在预热处理后的工件表面，经烘干固化、烧结处理，在工件表面得到富铬耐腐蚀涂层；涂覆料浆包括固相组分和液相组分；其中，固相组分包括铬粉、镍粉、铁粉和稀土化合物；所述液相组分包括Al(H 2PO 4) 3、水玻璃、卤化铵、聚乙烯醇及Cr 2O 3；在富铬耐腐蚀涂层表面喷涂一层超疏水材料，经固化处理得到疏水/富铬耐腐蚀复合涂层。通过对工件进行渗铬处理与超疏水处理，使工件具有耐腐蚀性、耐磨损性以及疏水特性，使管道内水蒸气无法停留在管道内壁，可避免对管道内壁的腐蚀，提高管道的综合性能，延长使用寿命。

abstract.text: Carbonaceous substance-coated graphite particles are disclosed that can be used as a negative electrode material for a lithium ion secondary battery. The carbonaceous substance-coated graphite particles include graphite particles and a carbonaceous substance covering at least part of surfaces of the graphite particles. A mass reduction starting temperature when the carbonaceous substance-coated graphite particles are heated in a water vapor atmosphere is 800° C. to 980° C., and a content of the carbonaceous substance is 0.1 to 15.0 parts by mass with respect to 100.0 parts by mass of the graphite particles.

abstract.text: Water vapor permeable ribbed membranes and related methods are provided. A water vapor permeable ribbed membrane has a top surface and a bottom surface opposite the top surface. The water vapor permeable ribbed membrane comprises a plurality of ribs located on at least the bottom surface. An adhesive layer is located on the plurality of ribs. When the adhesive layer is adhered to a top surface of another water vapor permeable ribbed membrane, the adhesive layer has a peel adhesion of at least 1.5 lb/in, as measured according to ASTM D3330 (Method B). The water vapor permeable ribbed membrane has a water vapor permeability of greater than 10 perms, as measured according to ASTM E96B.

invention_title.text: DEVICE FOR SYNTHETIC GAS PRODUCTION

abstract.text: Synthetic gas production device includes a bin 1 and heating section 2, which is disposed in combustion chamber and has diffusive part, which restricting area is directed to mixing chamber 7 and connected therewith passing pipe with diameter equal of said restricting area diameter. Mixing chamber 7 is executed in a form of truncated cone and disposed above gasification section. Raw bin is connected to mixing chamber with auger feeder 4. Water vapor feeding section 6 is disposed above gasification section, in mixing chamber area so, that together with raw mix and heat carrier feeding into gasification section the vapor feeding would be provided directly to said mix stream motion. Gasification section has diffusion part, as well, which restricting area is connected to a regenerator 8, having diffusive part connected to delivery mouth 10. Productional gas outlet means is connected to gasification section; furthermore, a device is equipped with a transporter 12 carring outgoing heat carrier-catalyst from device inner capacity through a lattice 11 into receving bin 1.

abstract.text: A method of establishing a furnace atmosphere in a directly heated heat treatment furnace is provided. A heat treatment furnace has at least one burner which is operated with a fuel gas and an oxygenous gas that are combusted to give a combustion gas. The combustion gas has a defined composition having a defined partial water vapor pressure. Hydrogen is used in the fuel gas with a proportion of at least 10% by volume. The heat treatment furnace is additionally flooded with a water vapor-free and/or hydrogen-free gas, as a result of which the water vapor-free and/or hydrogen-free gas mixes with the combustion gas so as to bring about a partial water vapor pressure of the mixture in the furnace atmosphere of the heat treatment furnace that is less than the defined partial water vapor pressure of the combustion gas.

abstract.text: A photovoltaic device, comprising: a photovoltaic generator whose electrical production power varies; an air humidifier device comprising: a storage compartment for atmospheric water vapor; means for heating and injecting the ambient air into the storage compartment; means for cooling and extracting the air flow available at the outlet of the storage compartment; an atmospheric water vapor condenser, which draws in the air flow previously humidified and cooled by the air humidifier device; a management module of the electrical power produced by the photovoltaic generator and used to electrically power the air humidifier device and the condenser device; said means for cooling and extracting the air flow being supplied with a variable electrical power controlled by the value of the surplus of photovoltaic electrical power available, from when the electrical power produced by the photovoltaic generator is greater than said electrical power used by the condenser.

abstract.text: A device and method for applying ZnAlMg layers or ZnAl layers to the front and rear side of a flat steel product, includes moving the flat steel product from an input side to an exit side of a zinc alloy melt bath, providing a dry gas stream, providing a water vapor gas, combining the dry gas stream and the water vapor gas to obtain a stripping gas as a mixture, determining the gas humidity of the stripping gas, discharging the stripping gas through at least one gas nozzle which serves to blow off the front side and through at least one gas nozzle which serves to blow off the back side in order to blow off the front side and rear side of the flat steel product with the stripping gas.
